reviews.review: Swayambhunath Temple. We went to this temple in mid afternoon. There were many merchants here who were extremely aggressive. It was a nice enough temple but didn't enjoy the merchants.

Monkey Temple. the amount of stairs comparable to Everet base camp trekking ;)Definately amazing view from top of Kathmandu. The temple itself it's big and can imporess everyone. The only drawback of the place is the fact, that there are a lot of rubbish and monkeys (yes!) which can attack you! yes! be careful with coca-cola bottle - hide everything, as monkeys love cola and they can jump on you to steal one....In general - must see place when you are in Kathmandu!
Excellent Service bye M.TREK EXP.. tour Guide . Hotel Accommodation , all arrangement about Trek Food . are excellent . every thing well planed. .

Kathmandu from Top. Swayambhunath Temple is situated at a little elavated area from where you can have an amazing view of Kathmandu city. Best part is you don't have to walk too much to get that view ;). Interestingly there is a small pool for Monkey's which is named as Monkeys' Swimming Pool. Temple was impacted from earthquake & you can still the ruins around.
Best place to meditate.. This place is also known as Monkey Temple because so many monkeys can be seen here. This is a very beautiful place, with so many people around.
Beautiful at sunset. Definitely worth seeing, stay for sunset. The 2015 earthquake did little damage to this temple. Make sure to explore the entire temple, not just one side.
2160 years old. one of the best sputa in Kathmandu from where we can see magnificent view of Kathmandu valley which one register in UNIS CO world heritage site.

View Kathmandu from the top. Even being a localite, i often visit this place with family on a weekend or when i have guests to visit kathmandu..It gives a beautiful view of the valley, the atmosphere is always lovely and ringing bells all around brings inner peace.A must visit when in Kathmandu.

Ancient Buddhist Temple on the Hill. Swayambhunath not only provides you with a gorgeous ancient temple to admire, but also a very good high level view of Kathmandu. A few hundred steps to the top of the temple (find monkeys on the way), but admire almost everything up at the temple!

a p lace with many reasons to visit this place.. A gigantic buddhist Stupa has been built on a place which is historically claimed as the place of Self Origination. The Temple premise is a place of faith both for Hindus and Buddhists at the same location. The Temple area is one of the very few places where religious Harmony is practiced at the same location.

Excellent views, very buzzy, hidden gem. At the top of the long stairs you have excellent views of the entire Kathmandu Valley. The stupa area was very buzzy when I visited, and filled up with stalls selling the usual stuff. However, behind the stupa hill is another hill with a monastery. Again, beautiful views, but also serenity and a more religious experience.

Must See Place. You can reach almost 60% by car. The balance we need to climb to reach the temple. The temple is too good. But cleanliness need to be maintained. I wish the authorities keep the temple and its surroundings clean.
Wow!. Absolutely stunning with a great view of Kathmandu. Great temples and swarming with monkeys. Try to beat the crowds by coming early or during lunch time.

Overlooking Kathmandu. Swayambhu is just a short taxi ride or half hour walk away from Thamel, easily accessible and offers an oasis of green and peace for both you and the monkeys. Breathtaking temple and view of Kathmandu and worth the 200NPR cover charge.

Serene place. Swayambodnath Stupa is a must visiting Kathmandu, sacred place for both Hindu & Bhuddist worshippers as well as great views of Kathmandu, especially in the clear autumn skies! Watch out for the monkeys don't feed them and be careful when taking photographs!

First step to explore - how harmoniously Buddhist and Hindu people live in Nepali society. It is an unique example of religious harmony - both Buddhist and Hindu worship in the same temple and live together. You will not find such example in any other religion.
Peaceful Place. it is also known as monkey temple. the view of kathmandu veally from there is beautiful. but be ware of many monkeys

Disappointed!. The site was surrounded by shops. Seemed more like a business rather than a heritage site.
Almost every inch of space surrounding the temple had a shop.

Beautiful stupa.. It's a beautiful stupa. There are two ways to reach it. One by foot climbing 365 stairs or by transport which drops at the backside from where you have to walk little bit. Beautiful view of whole Kathmandu can be seen from there. Lots of monkeys are there so local people call it monkey temple. Great place to meditate.
A must see in Kathmandu . Kathmandu 's list of things to see drastically was reduced by the earthquake last year but this place is still worth the visit!
Fusion of religions. Hindu and Buddist. An excellent experience and so spiritual. The views over Katmandu are beautiful. Monkeys, flags, Bougainvillia and temples.

Beautiful stupas with monkeys around! Great view of the city as well. One of the nicest stupas with reasonable entrance fee (200 rps). Nice park to hang around.. Watch the monkeys and enjoy the city view from higher grounds. Try to enter from the back entrance to avoid the killer 365 steps!
Hill top Stupa. The Stupa was located at the hill top and had excellent view of the entire Kathmandu. Lot of monkeys around the temple.

Although currently under restoration the stupa is still magical!. We visited this place 30 years ago and again recently. The effects of the earthquake are apparent as the stupa itself was under scaffolding and serious restoration was taking place. Even though there was work going on the place exudes a wonderful sense of peace and tranquility. Well worth the effort of battling through the traffic.
Trip to everest and site see katmandu . It's a must if visiting so much culture and history and monkeys running around loved the place. The views are amazing
Favorite place to visit in Nepal. Sunrise and Sunset walks around the Temple were very peaceful. Lots of shopping all around with Tibetan art and artifacts
Swoyambhunath. From the top of the swayambhunath, you can see whole kathmandu valley. Its also called monkey temple in Nepal.

More of a market than a religious site. It needs work to improve this site, generally dirty that needs repairs and upkeep. I was happy to pay an admission, just wish I knew it was being used well for the site. It is filled with stalls of people selling tourist junk which ruins the site as a religious or emotional experience. If u can blank out the vendors a worthwhile stop. It is a long walk up.
Nice place to visit. It was really fun to be there in one of the world cultural herritage site. I feel really blessed to be there. There are so many beaautiful scenes and sacred gumbhas to visit.
Ppanna. Panda. Good For Prayer for me And Can look around Kathmundu. I love very much Beautiful view and Have traveling come here many many.

An absolute must. Stunning, overwhelming, peaceful, energizing, and simply a mind-expanding attraction. When you find yourself in Kathmandu please have your taxi driver or guide take you here. It is more than a tourist attraction, it is a heart expanding experience. From the prayer wheels around the stupa to the fantastic array of souvenir shops and the Monks ready and willing to pray with you this stop will make you forget the hours of travel it took to get to Nepal.
"Very beautiful". Visited this monkey temple on our holiday to Kathmandu Nepal.we love this attractive place which is in the hill and you can see really good sunset. recommended.
good view from money temlpe we can see all kathmandu. so beautiful view from monkey temple we see all Kathmandu so beautiful , ithere so mush Buddhist people and many monkey .
Good view. One of this palace in kathmandu is really good and historical nile and heritage palace in kathmandu and nile view fram theiir

Quick pit stop tour . We came back from our Everest base camp trek and wanted to go to a couple of temples and chose this one (monkey) and durbar square (patan) as our two we wanted to sample. Regarding this temple essentially there's a couple hundred steps to climb which is where you'll find most of the monkeys, be careful as we came across one who didn't seem to want to let us pass and came quite aggressive, so if your taking young children bear in mind that they are wild animals and are unpredictable in nature. Once at the top you have a gold stupa with various temple elements surrounding. What I found disappointing was the amount of people trying to sell you things in and around the temple... This is one of the first temples I've visited in any Asian country which actually had people trying to sell within the temple grounds, I understand it's a poor country and people go where the tourists go to make an opportunistic sale, but kind of took the magic away for me. In the time it took to climb the stairs, have a look around the stupa and then a wander round the other side and reach the car park on the other side you need no longer than 1 hour to do this temple.
Great view. Amazing view at the top of this beautiful temple!! Happy to see that the earthquake didn't damaga it to much!

Good view. I jog up to the temple from Thamil. It's not too tough. Many Nepalese jogger. I was there around 630am. Already many people. Some to exercise, some to pray. Many monkeys even at foothill. Can see whole of Kathmandu Valley.
Nice view of Kathmandu. Walking distance from Thamel area. Quite a number of stairs to climb. Good view and cooling when reaching top. Entrance fee to pay at the top.

Highly spiritual and calm place. Early morning is the best,more or less 6-8 am you get the best of it.I have been there at all time of the day,even night.It is always magical,but early morning is special.I have visited that place for 19 years by now and I still go back every chances I get.

great place to see kathmandu vally. This is great to see all part of kathmandu vally and sun set.I suggest to all if you are looking for place to see sun set near to Thamel than this is one where you can have great view .Most of this things belong to Buddisium that you can see this small hill top and peace place .

A must see!. Part of what you must go and see when you come to Kathmandu. The steps are a killer but it is worth the climb after you get to the top. Plenty of vendors and monkeys to photograph on the way up, so take your time. A beautiful (?) view of Kathmandu will await you.

Steep steps. The monkey temple is attractive ovation with a great view. Worth the walk. Lots of vendors on top. Tons of monkeys at the entrance. 400 NPR from Kathmandu guest house. Cost 200 NPR for foreigners at the top. Lots of idol worship happening so be aware of that.

Worthy to Visit. This place gives you a complete Panoramic view of Kathmandu. You can watch sunset from this place but only if there is less SMOG which is common in Kathmandu since the earthquake. At evening sky is clogged with smoke and dust and you can barely see the city itself. Place itself is nice and worthy to visit even if most of the structures are damaged after earthquake and are being rebuilt.

Worth a climb. Located on the top of a hill that offers a view of the Kathmandu valley, this temple is a Must See . Not for people with weak legs. There is a 300 step steep climb to the temple with uneven stairs. One should take ample rest while climbing the stairs. There are several monkeys everywhere but are harmless. They tend to steal eatables only. The view from the top of the mountain is spectacular.The temple is interesting and yet again you would find loads of shops selling original and fake products. Overall experience was good .
Great views. Beautiful views from the top near the Stupa, fun to watch the monkeys, Another good place to visit in Kathmandu.
Monkey temple. yup its famously called monkey temple, it has beautiful view of Kathmandu.it is situated in hight and we had to climb lots of stairs but it was worth it.the monastery is must visit
A must to visit. Get a stuning overview of the city from Swayambunath. Enjoy the stairs and take of the monkeys. Admire the majestuous beauty the stuppa.

Intriguing . I'm glad I visited this temple. Since I walked here, I took a few wrong turns along the way, but once I could see the actual temple from the street, I easily found the way. It was interesting to see how devoutly the local people are in celebrating their faith : lighting candles and incense, ringing bells, spinning prayer wheels.

A visit to this famous spiritual pagoda is a must. I went in April 2013, The place is a buzz during the day-time with lots of market stalls surrounding the temple. Its great to go there early to see and photograph this spiritual palace before the crowds.

Interesting Temple. It was an interesting visit to the "Monkey Temple" where damage from the earthquake is still very evident in parts. There are great views over the city from different viewing areas. Watch the monkeys, they can be aggressive and will try and steal food and other items if given the chance. Also be careful of your belongings. We had no trouble, but had been warned to be careful
Amazing place. Very nice and clam place. Walking stairs . If you are in first time in Kathmandu you should visit this place.
Vibrant experience. The Swayambhunath Temple was better than expected, so many sights, sounds, and smells to explore! Amazing view of Kathmandu from the top of the hill.

Interesting Comparison of Hindu and Buddhist Religions. We were glad to climb the 360 steps for the overlook of Kathmandu which was quite a sight. The two temples were different in size and scope, the Hindu being small and surrounded by the Buddhist religious trappings. Our guide explained about the prayer wheels and the engravings on them. Interesting. But the shape of the religious icons and the dirtiness and dinginess of the entire place detracted from the experience. We have seem many religious icons and temples in Myanmar that are so much better cared for - it's sad that this religious place isn't cleaner. We enjoyed the monkeys and the fountain for world peace. This is a place every tourist should probably see but the Nepalese need to be more careful of their beautiful place.

"Beautiful architecture". This is a holy temple with fine work of architecture. To get here you have to walk with long stairs but once you get on top of the temple, it has great view of Katmandu &best sunset.
Touristy as all get out. the architecture was cool and I loved looking over Kathmandu, the monkeys were kind of cool but it was just so so so touristy
View tawer. People called Kathmandu view tower because it is in the high of Kathmandu and really good and heritage and historical palace in kathmandu

Enjoyful view. The temple have lots of monkey and from the stupa it looks fantastic view from there. We saw sun rise in the morning as well. Most of the house and monastory were distory by earthquick but still it look so quite and fresh air.
Its a must go obviously. You should visit here if you want to see the ancient structures of Hinduism and Budhism. There are several entrances to this place
nice view. Holy place , with a long stairs , after you reach the top you see the scenic view of kathmandu city.
Best place to see Kathmandu city form top.. Highly Recommended. 365 steps to climb !! there is also a different route to take your bikes. Marvel - Doctor Strange was shot here :)
An ancient Sclupture. This temple is really amazing. Almost every parts of kathmandu can be seen from this top place. The view is amazing!

Short climb to the top for views of the Kathmandu city. Visited the Buddhist stupa while in Kathmandu. Entrance fee was 50 NPR for Saarc country citizens. Beware of monkeys - as soon as we arrived they snatched a packet of baby wipes from our bag which was a funny experience. A short climb up the stairs will take you to the main stupa. You can go around it spinning the prayer wheels which is said to bring good luck. You will get great panoramic views of the Kathmandu city below. We found 2 sets of stairs, the one we took was easy. The other one we found was very steep and would have been considerably harder to climb up.

Unmissable Views of Kathmandu. You really won't appreciate the size and density of Kathmandu until you see it from above, and this is a great place for that. We only realized as we were leaving that we hadn't really taken the time to properly see the temple, but the view is spectacular enough to make the walk up the path worth it in any event. It was a bit crowded when we went, but I suspect that is often the case. With a little patience, however, we were able to spend all the time we wanted enjoying the view. On any visit to Kathmandu, be sure to set aside some time for this temple.

Fantastic view of the city. Once we got to the top of the (seemingly) thousands of steep stairs, the view looking over the city was breathtaking. Even before we got to the steps there were plenty of monkeys around the streets nearby and when we got to the Stupa at the top they were everywhere. Some hanging from prayer flags, others bathing in fountains, some stealing water bottles from tourists. A hilarious and picturesque day out.

Monkey see, monkey do.. What a lovely break from the bustle of Kathmandu. Had heard this was a favourite temple for locals, and not hard to see why - the monkey inhabitants add an extra touch of comedy and cuteness to the already impressive Buddhist temple complex on its hill overlooking Kathmandu. We walked there from the city - and while it's a log walk it's also a fascinating stroll through Nepalese city street life. The climb up here steps to the temple itself WAS a challenge, but all the more satisfying to reach the summit at the end. Bring your water - you'll need. It during and after climb's end. Definitely a highlight and must of any visit to Kathmandu.
beautiful Buddhist temple. This is a beautiful Buddhist temple of Nepal .people called monkey temple.There is Buddhist music .we can see all kathmandu vally view from there.

Who let the Monkeys out? Who? Who? Who?. The temple is one of the best things in kathmandu! We made a day trip to it and had a wonderful time! Because it is up a hill you can oversee all kathmandu. But most interesting is the beautiful Stupa which is constantly surrounded by little monkeys! But careful: they're are always seeking food, so be careful with your things! One monkey stole our water bottle! But if you want a calm day in the nature and away from the busy city, this is a wonderful place to be!

Kathmandu's most important Buddhist shrine. The sleepy, all-seeing Buddha eyes that stare out from the top have become t. Perched atop a hill on the western edge of the Kathmandu Valley, the ancient Swayambunath Stupa (known to tourists as the Monkey Temple) is Kathmandu's most important Buddhist shrine. The sleepy, all-seeing Buddha eyes that stare out from the top have become the quintessential symbol of Nepal.

Monkey temple did not disappoint . Got into Kathmandu and had time to head out to two local attractions. I was directed to Swayambhu aka The Monkey Temple. The pure beauty of this place is hard to tell even from pictures. Make it a must go on your next trip to Kathmandu.

Monkey Temple. Popularly known as a monkey temple in Nepal is one of the ancient stupa from where it is possible to have a panoramic view of the whole Kathmandu valley. It is also a place to get peace and tranquil infront of Lord Buddha.
Beautiful temple with a perfect view over Kathmandu. Temple was very beautiful and in good condition. From the top you have a very nice view over Kathmandu. Definitely worth the visit.

Neat Temple up top with cool views of Kathmandu. Monkeys everywhere, but don't be frightened. They do not steal nor bite. Just stay away from the mom and baby monkeys. It is some work going up climbing stairs on a humid day but pretty easy enough to do. The structure and the panoramic views of the city are both beautiful. Worth the stop if you are in Kathmandu.

Tranquil and solace. Not so far away from the chaos Kathmandu lies the placid swayambhunath. Religiously visited by Buddhist and Hindu alike, it's the center of attraction for all walks of life. The peace and tranquility take us back to the Gautam Buddha's lap. Just preach 'om mane padme ho!'

visit to the temple. The visit to swambhunath was so so. I could not find any plaint explaining the history of the temple. the place seems to be in shambles where nobody is worshipping and everybody is interested in taking photo of Kathmandu city as it is on a hill top.

must visit. visit this place to get a sense of peace and history. go with a guide and listen to the story and history of this place. the earthquake hasnt damaged this place a lot and its still very beautiful.

Market not a Temple, Waist of Time. This Buddhist Temple (Monkey Temple) is a waist of time. It is dirty, it is a market to hawk replicas, and touristy items you will wonder "why did I buy this piece of junk". There is construction to repair from the earthquake, but its still cluttered, dirty, pigeon poop, stinking water puddles, few beggars, maybe a monkey or two in the day time. Monkeys come out routinely to be fed by tourist, thus like a bit of a zoo rather a temple. Dogs roam free. Parking lot rubbish and on the floor too. No sign of genuine spiritual retreat or focus. Walking out we agreed it was just drab, no smiles anywhere. You might be inclined to give to a beggar or pick up an ice cream just outside the entry/exit too. Don't expect to see a Buddhist monk they are done below on the other side of the parking lot. The boy monks I saw counting some money and laughing and the man monk coming out of the toilet. There is a nice view but we were ready to go after 30 minutes.
Family visit. We caught a rickshaw from Thamel, the views are worth the trip alone but the temple was good as well.

Peaceful Monkey Temple in the midst of Kathmandu. Very tranquil and peaceful temple setting with awesome views...and lots of monkeys at the base of the temple.You can either walk up the very 'steep' steps (around 365 stone steps) or take a taxi around the winding road upto the temple entrance.There is a Wishing Pond at the base of the temple.* Please do not feed the monkeys or keep food items in view of the monkeys, keep the food inside your backpack or bags.
Trademark of Nepal. This place is very distinctive of Nepal. The classic temples, the protected wildlife that is in here and the awesome people that live in this gorgeous place.
The monkey temple. Great view from the top. Interesting experience with the monkeys (be careful though, as they will still your food, and aggressively). Great climbing exercise.

Don't miss the "Monkey Temple". I was so excited when I learned Swayambhunatn Temple was a stop on our guided tour! It was everything I hoped it would be! The views are breathtaking and photo-worthy, the brightly colored flowers and trees, and colorful prayer flags, with ancient Buddhas and of course, the monkeys! I really could have spent hours there exploring the shops and taking pictures. When I saw the 365 stairs I was super relieved our guide parked at the top of the hill!

Too many shops!. The plus side is that it's really secluded from the center of the city. You can have a great view of kathmandu on the top.Minus- it's too crowdy with shop owners; they won't let you stay and stare at any part of the temple without being approached to buy their "authentic" paintings or other stuff! A tad bit annoying I must say.
A place you feel at home. It's a must to see! A peaceful place. Experience going upstairs - there are 365 steps. Make a wish and go round the Stupa 3 times clockwise.
Nice. Like it... a lot steps took to get to this place but really nice..be aware of monkeys hehe..hey are as usual bad boys
Must see, but touristy. Money is made off of tourism. Plan to spend around $10 USD but very unique and worth the price. Visit the monks, give a donation, and get something blessed.

Touristy. The stupa at the pinnacle of this site was damaged in the earthquake. It is still under construction. It is still a nice climb up the long flight of stairs to get to the top. Nice views from there over the valley of Kathmandu.

Beware of the monkeys. We went here as part of a city tour with Himalayan social journey, after our trek to Everest base camp. It was an interesting touristy place. Lots of stalls with things for sale. We had the obligatory Thanka/Mandela paintings where we had a fine 360 degree view from the roof of the shop. We walked around the stupa and coming from a country without monkeys were intrigued by them. Make sure you don't get too close though as their hiss and growl and lunge at you which I found scary. There were people conducting prayer ceremonies. It was interesting and the views were spectacular. The cost was 250 rupees and it was worth the entrance fee for the experience and view.

adorable place. nice view of Kathmandu city....lots of monkeys around the place....one of the best Buddhist pilgrimage sites....lots of Hindus and Buddhists sculptures......wonderful place for hangout !!!!!!!!!

Monkey Temple . A very holly place for every religions . Stupa itself refers to Buddhist philosophy but there is Saraswati Temple together. It's good place to view the views of the Kathmandu valley. The best time to visit sight at early morning or before evening rather than day time.

Spectacular views but beware of thieves and pickpockets!. A beautiful temple with very well-behaved monkeys. The views over Kathmandu are absolutely spectacular. The only downside to the place are highly skilled thieves and pickpockets. My husband had his watch stolen from his wrist. We have no idea how and when it happened. Impressive!

Must see in Kathmandu. If Kathmandu had one place to visit then this is it. Perfect place to join the locals and experience Nepalese Buddhism. Heaps of monkeys, hence why it is called the Monkey Temple. Over 300 steps to the top but lots of rest spots on the way up. Stairs are a bit steep towards the top but the climb is worth it,
Swayambhu. Monkey temple.lots of monkeys around.nice view of valley from the top.peace and good Time spending place

20 minutes walk for sun rise and sun set views of kathmandu and surrounds. The Swayambhunath Temple is on the top of the hill which surrounded by the Monasteries, chorten and temples and thick and huge jungle and trees are on back which keeps the atmosphere clean and neat. The view of kathmandu valley including patan, bhaktapur and Nepal international airport are imagine.The sun rise and sun set vies with rainbow in the valley are superb and it doesn't take long time to reach there. It is only 20 minutes walks from themal and same time when you back.You will have more reviews once you visit the Temple. Have fun. Rankesh
easy walking from thamel,. beautiful place easy to reach from thamel , great view of kathmandu,the monkey temple it's on top of a hills, and there are some work in progress.
amazing views. we saw a beautiful kathmandu city and monkey.. beautiful place and the temple. people are very nice and lots of prayer flags which feel your soul relax.
Wishing well. If you have a wish, this is the place to go to realise them! But make sure you aim well to make your wish come true!!!
Monket Temple. Very nice and peaceful place with beautiful view of kathmandu valley. But be aware of monkeys. You must visit this place while youare in kathmandu
magic. one of the best stupa tawer call swayambhunath temple in tawn is really good and historical also nise budish musium inside
Must see!. One of the most beautiful temples in Kathmandu. Provides an amazing view over the city and the monkeys make it extra amusing.
Very nice place. Very nice view you can see from here. Around 2.5 km from thamel .we enjoyed our trip here. We saw Buddha stupa very old antiques things. Advice to go there.
good velly view. Top of the hill see all Kathmandu valley view it is very nice place and many monkey over there and many step for walking

Magnificent view, Unforgettable 365 steps. Souvenirs can be found at Thamel. I went with my friend and her mum on the second last day before I flew back to Singapore. It was really a great experience where I saw some hogs at the river on the way. Another name for it was called the Monkey Temple. There were so many monkeys there and they were waiting for us to feed them. If you have yet to visit the stupa, you can visit this where you can find the iconic buddha eyes.The climb up was great and it wasn't tiring compared to the mountain climbing I did a few days before. The view was breathtaking and they sold many religious items which you can actually find if you shop around thamel.

Nice and ethnic point of interest. Lots of monkeys and great views of the Kathmandu Valley. Worth a visit to see the old structure. Good landmark to visit if you have time on your hands. Definitely not a must see.

Great View of Kathmandu. Great view of the city. Leave Thamel at 5am, get a taxi for no more than 300rps, to the temple for sunrise. A 10 min walk up a steep flight of stairs. Lots of monkeys, but they would generally not come near you unless you have food to offer. Remember to respect the locals praying there. Part of the structure destroyed from the earthquake. I heard that you had to pay 500rps to enter the place, but I went in for free. Couldn't find any ticket booths.
A must-see!. Overlooking a lot of Kathmandu, it is worth the hike up. Lots of monkeys everywhere!Trinkets and souvenirs tend to be highly overpriced compared to the main streets.
Religious. The stupa is located on a hilltop, grant an overview of the dense buildings of Kathmandy valley. The temple is religious to the locals but may not be fascinating to the ordinary tourists.

On the top of a hill. Do not hesitate to climb the 365 steep steps uphill to the temple. There are a lot of monkeys around trying to snatch food from you. You have a nice view over Kathmandu once you are up there.

temple at the top of the hill. beautiful temple located at the top of a hill. you must climb to the top by way of a staircase (very manageable). great views of the city. lots of vendors selling souvenirs but a bit more expensive than the ones closer to city center

Must see evening walk from Thamel. Download the route to and from and start around 3 so you reach by 4 to see the stupa at sunset. You arrive at the steps take the left side wall with prayer scrolls until the end then up the long stairs. This avoids the ticket counter (200nr for foreigners) or was it late and low season? ;-)Don't forget the view from café de stupa at dusk ;-) then dinner at the Korean restaurant down close to the bus station :-p

Eyes of Buddha. A world heritage site and a must visit attraction for all. Its a beautiful stoopa on top of a hill. You can see full view of Kathmandu from there. It also has a Temple which got damaged due to earthquake.Best time to visit is early in morning before 9am ..

Worth the long hike to the top. If you are thinking of visiting Kathmandu and the Monkey Temple, get mentally prepared for the 300+ steps to the top (and back down again). The monkeys were a novelty as this was our first temple visit in Nepal, but in reality we found just as many monkeys wandering the other major tourist attractions. The activities at the top are fairly interesting, and quite a few religious pilgrims are present to perform their rituals, along with crowds of tourists. There is a small entry fee for non-Nepalese towards the top of the staircase, but it was a very nominal fee. If you are going to see the Temple, and the view from the top, it is worth the trip. If you only want to see monkeys but aren't interested in the climb, you will see more than enough at the other attractions in Kathmandu.

Spectacular holy site. The Swayambhunath temple is remarkably beautiful, a mountaintop shrine that extends downwards on two sides. The monkeys are not aggressive but rather amusing to watch, and the amount of day-to-day religious observance going on at the top is wonderful to observe.Remember to circle religious sites in a clockwise direction.

Great buddist temple on Hill. I love the whole complex take a steps or go by taxi , you still need climb few steps , great aerial view of KTM city amazing art work Different entry fee for SARC nation and foreign tourist even would good time to go , you can watch sunset

Suppose to be a great architecture religious building. This suppose a majestic religious temple. Big majestic stupa sitsatthe top of the hill. You need to climb thousand of steps up to the hill. I suggest the visitor to enter from eastgate rather then west gate. More attractive. Lot of monkeys running around and pigeons, but thats the beauty and the harmony between human and nature.Its a beautiful scenery of Kathmandu city from the top of the hill. One thing make me sad, the maintenance of the place is not good, bit dirty.
Good. Me and my butther been in shyambhunath temple is verry good you havr to walk little bit stap verry good stupa also small gungal around
SWAYAMBHUNATH. It is a very big complex of temples. We had to climb around 200 steps to reach it. There are statues of the Buddha.

The monkey Temple!. When I saw the monkeys around this ancient temples, then I came to know, why this temple is known as monkey temple. I could observe the kathmandu valley clearly. Recommended to every one.
Great. Great peaceful place. Sunset is perfect time to visit I think. It called Monkey Temple but we saw much more dogs, be careful.

Swayambhunath Temple: View Whole Kathmandu Valley. I am so glad to get the wonderful view of the entire Kathmandu Valley from this holy temple. It is one of the oldest temples in Nepal. Be aware of monkeys while visiting here.

Great experience, very spiritual with amazing views of Kathmandu. Climbed to the top of the temple and certainly wasn't let down. Great views of the city and a very enlightening experience on Buddhism. Monkeys are everywhere, so keep food hidden away otherwise you'll get mugged; one even nicked our map the cheeky git. Best part of the experience was heading into a shop opposite an alley where 'Cafe (something)' Is written on the wall. We met a lovely shop owner who practices meditation and he gave us an in-depth lecture on singing bowls; how they help you relax and cleanse your chakras. My girlfriend and I both left feeling super chilled after he made us both sit and listen binaurally to the sounds. As a musician, I found this really interesting and ended up buying one bowl off him. Only downside is that, with it being a tourist hotspot, there are plenty of stalls trying to sell you gifts and there were a few young (children) beggars, which was slightly distracting from the whole 'spiritual' experience. Had a lovely time overall though!
Be cautious about crazy monkies. Nice with steep stairs, monkies are not well educated! Don't feed them and don't pass through cut ways passing the trees.

Mr. On the hilltop giving you a very good view of Nepal. A place to pray and put coins in the centre where there is water. Lot of monkeys around and also lots of shops around. Historical place. A place on hilltop to pray and light lamps.

Beautiful Temple with wonderful View of Kathmandu. Monastery is destroyed by earthquake . This monastery is quite beautiful and well worth a visit. I found this to be quite interesting and confusing at the same time. In fact, most of the sacred Buddhist sites I went to did not always seem like they were Buddha sites due to the number of Hindu religious practices and ceremonies being performed.

स्वयंभू. First of all, do not take the easy way to reach the stupa. Take the long stairs. It is tiring.Yes. But it is breathtaking. The view you get when you climb the steep stairs is just priceless.Secondly, the story of how it originates. Do read it beforehand so you can understand the significance of this place. It is one of my favourite.Thirdly, this place is full of tantrism. The stories are too tempting not to read. There is one old building next to the stupa itself which houses various tantric scriptures and other one nearby where it is believed that a tantric is still meditating after hundreds of years. Both the places are closed for public.Lastly, the reconstructions are still going on after the 2015 earthquake but that won't be an issue. It is full of visitors everyday. If you go there on a clear sunny day, then you get a good view of KAthmandu valley from the top.(A must see view).

Reconstruction after earthquake. The main stupa itself is ok, but the smaller temples around are in reconstruction. There are piles of gravel, bricks, tarps, and A LOT of rubbish. I recommend climbing the 365 steps at the front, instead of driving up the back: there are plenty of nice statues, lots of monkeys, and a giant prayer wheel at the front. The little museum is free. It is an easy walk from Thamel (4km, 40min).

A perfect place to look around the concrete jungle of Kathmandu. I live within 2 kilometers from the Swoyambhunath stupa. I grew up playing around the temple.There are hundred of legacies, manuscripts and scriptures written about how settlement started in Kathmandu valley. One as such is associated with Swoyambhu Nath stupa. It is said that Kathmandu used to be a lake(daha). When the lake water receded from the gorge, there was a shrine around a lotus which is where Swoyambhu nath is today. This is one of the most heard stories while growing up.It is also believed that there is "astu" of Gautam Buddha in the stupa.You can have a 360 degree view of the Kathmandu Valley from the stupa.But as a resident, I find the mornings and evenings, very blissful. Early morning, you will find young, old, male, females everyone walking. Irrespective of your religious faith, if you are a Nepali and a resident nearby, you would walk around. You would pray. The evenings are cheerful around the stupa. We spend a lot of time, meeting friends over a cup of tea.

Magical!. This is a must see while in Nepal! You can take the back entrance to avoid climbing the 365 steps that lead up to the stupa, unless that is something you want to do... Lots of activity and energy here.

Amazing !. Once you made it up the steps to the Stupa on top of a hill, you get rewarded with a great view ! And besides the majestic Stupa you come across monks, monkeys, and peaceful place!Don't miss it !

Great views!. A great place to go for good views of the city. If it's a good day with clear skies you can even see the mountains in the distance. Quite a climb, but worth it. Lots of super cute monkeys, but just keep an eye open if you have food with you!At the World Peace Pond, you can try your luck throwing coins - if they enter the urn/bowl it means good luck for you! Jogging with sightseeing in Kathmandu valley. Swayambhunath Stupa, which is known as “the Monkey Temple” is best place in Kathmandu valley for those people who are looking for Jogging trails. It is situated just 4 km from Thamel. You can walk 30 min from Thamel and drive to foot hill from all major places. There is 365 steps (which represents 365 days of our life) to climb. Every day in the morning before dawn hundreds of Buddhist and Hindu pilgrims ascend those steps from this eastern side to the hill and past the gilded Vajra (The Thunderbolt) and two lions guarding the entrance, and begin a series of clockwise circumambulations of the main stupa. From the Swayambhunath is the best view of the entire Kathmandu valley and some Himalaya range. There are various temples and shrines around the main stupa. Though it is Buddhist temple both Hindu and Buddhists worship there.You can explore local lifestyle, culture and tradition on the way.

Amazing. Monkey Temple!!! - This is a great way to spend the afternoon -

Absolutely spiritual temple. What a fascinating place filled with tourists and locals alike. Spanning a huge area with several stupas and places of worship, it has a very peaceful atmosphere despite all the busy movements around.Several locals were busy cleaning and polishing the various statues and it was good to see the earnestness of their approach in cleaning.There are also a area where they have stalls selling various artefacts and paintings and touristy goods. Those seemed well supported by the throngs around.There are many monkeys walking around freely and one naughty one swiped some food from an unsuspecting female that shrieked, but very few people took notice possibly indicating that it was a regular occurrence.From the top one can see over the Nepal valley - quite a breath-taking view. There is a wishing well and vendors changing money into coins seemed to have a brisk trade.The compound also hosts the Whochen Thokjay Choyaling Monastery. The monuments of the Swayambhu area have been recognised as a world heritage site. Whilst there seems to have been an entry fee, the gate where I walked in from was unattended so I paid nothing ...

Great View. A visit to ktm is not complete without going to this temple. Its 365 steps uphill that leads to the temple with incredible views of the city. Theres an entrance fee for foreigners, i think 400 npr. On the way up you will come across loads of monkeys and also if you wish to skip the steep stairs up you can go climb around the hill through a garden that leads to the temple.Please go there with an open mind, its not exactly as tidy as it should, theres trash everywhere and its filled with souvenir shops all around the temple. Just enjoy the city view, take good pictures, take a sip of some fresh coconut juice and appreciate the architecture. For devotees, its a must to visit.

view of full kathmandu. From this place you can actually see the beUty of kathmandu . But yes beware of monkeys as you will find alot of them here.

Worth the effort . To reach the Stupa its quite a strenuous climb up many hundreds of stone steps, not for the front of heart. Also still under repair but the views from the top are great. Lots of monkeys here and some are quite aggressive if you have food.

Beautiful but with some issues. Even though the 2015 earthquakes damaged the site pretty badly, the main stupa remained completely intact. I liked the place, the views on the city and the monkeys.Having said that there were two issues that bugged me a lot.-The way they enforce the entry fee is next to ridiculous. If you look somewhat foreign, they will pull you out of the queue and take you to the ticket booth. Even though its displayed that everyone has to pay, they will only let foreigners pay, which is completely wrong (but seems to be the standard in Kathmandu valley) Oh, on a side note, while I was paying for my ticket, a ton of other tourists managed to get in for free. This randomness is just annoying.-There are a lot of vendors at the stupa, and they are very very persistentIf it wasn't for these issues I'd rate this place higher, because its probably one of the coolest places in Kathmandu to visit.

I'll never forget this amazing temple !. I visited the Swayambunath Temple on May, for the first time, in this place you will be understand Bouddhiste Religion and all the precepts about Buddha when you are inside you feel free !!!

Peaceful hilltop setting, panoramic views of Kathmandu. Of the three places we visited on our last day in Kathmandu on a half day tour before we headed for the airport this was the best. Set on top of a hill with ample parking it is serene and peaceful. With prayer flags fluttering it's calming and good for the soul.And the views from the stupa of the Kathmandu panorama is amazing. A very peaceful place. When I am at Swayambhu, I feel a lot of peace. There are monasteriesall around the stupa. The stupa and monasteries suffered a lot from the 2015 earthquake, but by now most has been rebuild. So to support the Tibetan community who lives on the Swayambhu hill, it's very helpful to bring a visit to this beautiful area.

A Bustling Hilltop Temple. Great for Photos. Allocate a Few Hours.. Unless you're up to it, don't be discouraged by the steep 365 step stairway. You can ask the driver, if you rent a private car or taxi, to take you to the back gate and walk up the paved walkway for 5 minutes to reach the temple. Up on the hill, this second holiest Buddhist temple (after Boudhanath) provided awesome view of the city and was loaded with locals performing religious rituals. It's a big complex rich with activities. The large white stupa with gold ornament on top was surrounded by lots of smaller shrines. You can also find souvenir shops, stalls, restaurants, museum, library, etc. Spent a few hours strolling around and took pictures (Apr. 2015).

A moderate climb but really nothing to see... Every tourist was seen at the edge of the hill taking pictures of the Kathmandu Valley. It's a good visit for about 2.5$.

Amazing experience with a breath taking view. We went expecting another temple, but the place took us by surprise. The view from the temple which is on a hill top was breath taking. we stood enjoying the sky clouds and the beautiful site of the houses on the hill side. A must visit. My children enjoyed the entire area rolling the chanting rolls around the temple, the little shops with all kinds of articles and not to mention the monkeys
A variety of shrines and temples. The stupa has Buddha's eyes and eyebrows painted on. long stairway with 365 steps, leading directly to the main platform of the temple

Business with A Little Pleasure Mixed In. Swayambhunath Stupa is known as a Monkey Temple because of the large tribe of roving monkeys who guard the temple. The temple is among one of the UNESCO World Heritage site and its surroundings are said to be home to hundreds of monkeys, considered holy by believers. Many of Swayambhunath’s structures suffered considerable damage in the earthquake and the aftershock of April 2015. The Anantapura shikhara to the left of the steps toppled and there was serious damage to buildings on the west side of the Stupa. We hired a private vehicle to reach Swayambhunath Stupa Temple, which also took us to the top of the monkey temple. But, the most beautiful way to reach the top of this temple is to climb the 365 stairs of the temple. That’s assuming that you are either in excellent shape or you are young! The view from the top is spectacular.

Good place in Kathmandu. It is a good place in Kathmandu.You can look at the beautiful architecture.It is a great place to visit whichever religion you are,but you shouldn't miss going here at all if you are a Buddhist.

A living heritage on the HIll Top. 365 steps up! The typical Nepalese stair cases guides you to one the most beautiful Stupa that you would ever see in your life. When your eye strikes to the greatest thunderbolt of the planet and this beautiful buddhist architecture, you feel that you are lifted up, little bit enlightened. The most attractive view point and the pilgrimage inside Kathmandu valley.

A profound experience. This is a beautiful and very spiritual area to visit while you are in Kathmandu. I would suggest visiting early in the morning if you are able - the monkeys may be a lot more prominent (it is also known as the 'Monkey Temple') but the humans are not, and the atmosphere at this time of day around this ancient monument is magnificent. If you do go later in the day, you will find the many associated activities and souvenir opportunities in full swing. If you get caught in the rain, be wary of the numerous steps leading up to the temple site, as they can be quite slippery.
Incredible. It has been our favourite temple. We enjoyed very much with the monkeys (but be careció with them) and the temple is very impressive

Very nice place! . The place is very high up to hill, but it's worth every step. You must be careful when climbing up especially whet it rains because the steps can be very slippery. The view from the top is absolutely amazing! The temple is also very nice, it wasn't demanded by the earthquake. Also there is one smaller temple from the other side. Must see in Kathmandu.The price is also very fair - 200 of their money.P.S. Yes I've forgotten - there are a lot of monkeys (among tourists it's called Monkey temple), and be aware they steal food from the bags!

Absolutely amazing. Money temple is one Of my favourite places in Kathmandu! There are a lot of stairs that you have to climb to reach the top but once when you do, the view is stunning ! Also, there are so many monkeys around :) Perfect place, so beautiful for taking photos!!
must see. there are so many awesome to see and do, but this temple needs to be at the top of your list, a very moving experience

Interesting . The place is nice and a good experience also, Nepali people are friendly and peaceful and you can feel it when you go such places, I saw one dog there protecting one small monkey from another monkey I felt peacefully, the view also is so nice it's worth it.The only thing is need little more cleaning and awareness to people not to through garbage in such places, they have to redistribute garbage bins there

Very interesting place. VERY high up if you climb all the steps. I believe it's over 350 steps, give or take a few. By the time you were to get up there, you wouldn't really care! There are monkeys all over the place here because of the jungle surrounding the steps. You can find some people selling souvenirs, but there's no pressure to buy.

Swayambunath Temple day trip. UNESCO heritage centre very colourful and it's called by some as Buddha eyes. Beautiful & exotic. Don't use the short cut and drive up. Go up the steps. You get a beautiful view of whole Kathmandu at the top. Lovely place

Awesome place. Very nice to walk around with fluttering prayer flags and playful monkeys jumping through the trees. We didn't have any problems with the monkeys being aggressive and the entrance cost is reasonable. An easy 30min walk from thamel (if you have a map).
magical!. this temple feels magical with its surrounding neighborhood, too bad it was too expensive and seems a rip off for the stores and restaurant.
Worth full visit. visiting this old and beautiful place is worth full from where you can see very nice view of kathmandu valley. stupa is very nice itself

Swayambunath Temple ( Monkey Temple). This is one of the holy places for Buddhist and Hindu followers inside Kathmandu Valley. Great location to view Kathmandu valley. It is walking distance from Thamel area.

Interesting but needs better upkeep. Our conference organizers arranged for us to visit this temple and so we travelled by bus in a group.The road winds uphill and we parked at some point and alighted.We followed series of steps to arrive breathless at the temple.However we couldn't get the benefit of information from our tour guide as the group became disorganized and scattered.The temple has several buildings comprising shops selling Nepalese artwork and some restaurants.There were several statutes of Bhudda and numerous religious relics and artifacts ..At the center of it was a round structure with a tower with eyes on the four sides watching over the premises.On the structure were some rooms and some window like open endings covered with intricate artwork and padlocked.One of the rooms had a priest who blessed the adherents who came to worship.There were also altars where incense and other sacrifes were burnt.There were several monkeys and dogs who mostly kept to themselves.They temple overlooks the city and from that vantage point you could have a panoramic view of the bustling city stretching far into the valley.Overall an interesting place but not well kept,cleaned or well maintained.

Swayambhunath. It is located in heart of the Kathmandu valley from where we can see the beautiful scenario of Kathmandu valley from the top. Swayambhunath is also a home of monkey around the valley where they feel secure and more relief. Swayambhunath is also listed on world heritage site of Nepal.It took us about 45 min from Bhaktapur to reach there. Many local and international tourist visit daily to find and observe the beautiness of Swayambhunath temple.

Must visit temple in Kathmandu. It took us around 30 minutes to reach Swayambhunath from our hotel in Thamel. Go for a guide only if you're interested in knowing the history behind this temple. Or else just enjoy the stunning views from the top. Suggestion:1) You should visit this temple during early morning hours or early evening hours. Or whenever it turns cloudy. 2) The atmosphere is very calm and peaceful. One should enjoy the views and also feel the city from the height. The landlock-ness can be seen.3) Beware of Monkeys. Try avoiding eating anything in front of them.
monkey and view, family loves it. for family trip is a nice place, but you need to be able to climb stairs, view is great from up. enjoy the coconut drink looking at valley sitting high up
Best visit. Best place to visit for cultural spritual religious and natural well being. A must visit place in a very convenient location within the heart of kathmandu valley

A perfect viewpoint!. A perfect visiting place inside Kathmandu valley. Among of the places Swyambhu which is also knwon as the Monkey Temple is the very impressive viewpoint of Kathmandu. The scenario of the Kathmandu seen from the Hilltop Swyambhu is outstanding.
On the roof. Take the 300 hard step steps or drive the back way. Love the view and mixture of hindu and buddha. Many naughty monkeys.

Fantastic view. My guide and friend Bijay took me there and it was the fantastic place for the view of the city and know more about Buddhist history and culture. I enjoyed the visit more. Thanks Bijay for recommending this place.

One of the first temple built around Kathmandu Valley where you get to see the fusion of hinduism and buddhism .. Literally on top of the hill where you get to see the bird's eye view of kathmandu valley and of course monkeys . As the temple is also known as monkey temple.

STUNNING. This was my #1 sight in Kathmandu - I totally loved this place. Go on a Saturday to see the locals enjoying this place and give yourself some time to soak it all up. Peaceful and interesting at the same time. I chose to go at sunset for particular kinds of photos, but it's not everyone's cup of tea (tricky to get clear photos of the details). I didn't do the steps due to poor health but really enjoyed the sight.

A must-see place in Nepal (especially just at nightfall). I've been here so many times and at all times of the day. The best for me is just as the candles are lit at dusk, when so many pilgrims and others start circling and praying. A wonderful atmosphere and an amazing experience. Just ignore the tourist shops and the few tourists taking flash photography. Not yet enough of them to spoil this Buddhist cultural icon.

Long walk for the reward, amazing view though. This temple has a religious meaning, but for me it didn't pay off to climb all those stairs to see the temple... it was very crowded and the only thing that was good was the view, amazing view!
A must in Kathmandu. We were eager to visit this temple. There is a small entrance fee but it is worthy. Monkeys will not disturb you and the views are amazing. Better use a car to get in there

Ancient Temple. It was built in 5th century during Licchabi period by Kussan community . Located on dominant hilltop from where one can have fantastic view of Kathmandu City . In two ways one can go to the temple .One by climbing 365 stairs .To get the personal prayer fulfilled some follows that and others go by cars or jeep.It has nice parking lot and a tea shop too.This temple is know as monkey temple too because of lot of monkeys. There are many small temple beside the main stupa . Like all other places there are numerous shops . Also we saw some film shooting was in progress.. There is another Temple on a hillock left of this one. That is less crowdy .

Breathtaking view...and monkeys!. We were lucky to visit this place during monsoons-despite it being an off-season in Nepal. As this temple is on a hill we were able to see the mountain amidst the clouds. There is a point from where you can view Kathmandu entirely-so don't miss getting a click or two there. A word of caution-beware of the naughty monkeys! Try not to carry bags or food items as they try to snatch them.

Warren Jones. Commonly known as the 'Monkey Temple', it's a good place to visit if your wanting to take in the culture. With 000's of prayer flags in strings overhead & shrines etc built centuries ago. As a bonus, being on a hilltop, on a clear day you can see across the metropolis of Kathmandu.

Despite the earthquake, fascination remains. Despite all the destructions, this is one of my favorite places to revisit over and again. Peaceful atmosphere, beautiful structures and nice walks around. Definitely a must go!!
amazing pure world heritage. lovely place if u like bit of religious types. u can see pure nepali culture mixed with tibetian culture. excellent view from the place

Hiking the Monkey Temple. climbing up so many steps the view from the top is breathtaking. the whole Kathmandu valley is visible. the monkeys are all around but they do not bother. the stupa is magnificent with its golden dome and the eyes of Buddha. the small temples curio shops adds to the grandeur. Sunset view should not be missed.

Best Ever. Thank you so much my friend Ganesh.
He is really best.From this temple we see Kathmandu valley very well.and a lot of information about Buddisam and Hindusm.
Lovely temple and short walk from Hotel Vajra. Lots of steps and very nice shops on the top. Good view of valley. Short walk from Hotel Vajra up the hill.

A Buddhist monastery loads of rich heritage and a place must to visit anyone in Kathmandu.. This temple of lord Buddha is stretched in a vast area full of greenery and Buddhists flag all over the path with 3 huge statues of the lord and I can vouch that these are very peculiar and a piece of art these are situated right before the entrance on the main road it as lamp house and very calm and clean area with lot of worshipers around then there is a road which leads to the prayer halls and stupas for performing pujas.The cold breeze flows on the top and the entire city is visible from all the view points and the view is fantastic especially clickers and this place being rich in architecture and heritage will engulf you in this richness which goes on deepening as one starts exploring this world of swayambhu.It has small temples outside and some ornamental structures hanging over the old temples generally made of wood.There are steps for climbing and going down with monkeys all around do not be afraid they wont pounce upon unless they see a food article or feel threatened there is a pond in which you throw coins you can get the change there are small shops rendering this people are good but remain careful as we all do while travelling at any place.Its a heritage site so please maintain the sanity of the place.

don't miss it!. our first day trip started with swayambhunath temple! since we were there early by 9, monkeys were slowly waking up. didnt get to see them dive or swim. felt so divine going around the temple but some how felt undone, so we decided to visit again on our 3rd day of the trip. it was soo much fun to witness the monkeys sleeping in groups or families. by the time we took three rounds and spent quality time on top, all monkeys were awake. felt good feeding few with cucumbers. it was awesome to see them come one by one and take it from hand. the monkeys had fun diving and swimming in the water tank which is kept for them to bathe. the shops on top are reasonable comparing to the shops in thamel.

An amazing Unescorted. World Heritage Site.. This Buddhist temple is amazing but it needs more respect. The white stupa has suffered some damage from the earthquake but not so it will detract from your visit. There are a few detractors like smell, graffiti, overpopulation of the monkeys but if you can over look this it is not to be missed. Definitely go in by claiming the 300 plus steps on the Eastern side. It is easy to get a taxi up to the temple.

Great Place. Swayambhunath Stupa is the most ancient and enigmatic of all the holy shrines in Kathmandu valley. Its lofty white dome and glittering golden spire are visible for many miles and from all sides of the valley. Historical records found on a stone inscription give evidence that the stupa was already an important Buddhist pilgrimage destination by the 5th century AD.

good and divine place to visit in kathmandu. a good and divine place to visit. this is slightly on hilly side for 2-3 kms from city. pleasent climate. a visit to such place gives peace of mind. few steps ( approx 100 - 150 ) to be climbed. entry ticket is reasonable rates. well maintained. beware of monkeys if carrying eatables :).form top the city view is fascinating. overall a must visit place when in Kathmandu

Sunset point with Katmandu valley view. Though the earthquake has made some damage to the temple but it still stand tall with a majestic view of the temple and the Katmandu valley. If you are not good with stairs ask your taxi to take you from the back or you always can climb some steep steps if you want to stretch your legs before your trek. Be there for the sunset, though there are a lot of monkeys but as long you are not feeding them they don't pose any problem to you.

I think a must see. This is a unique experience and I would consider it a must see. We went early in the morning. Great sunrise and city views if the weather cooperates and hundreds of local people exercising. The religious artifacts are very interesting here.Lots of monkeys here at the "monkey temple" which made it even more interesting to me.
Visit heaven trek. I love that place , peaceful. Worth it to visit with Visit heaven trek. Lovely and friendly country, i love it. Wish i can visit again.

For a nice view among the monkeys. If you are not afraid of going up a long stairway, include this spot on your list to visit.The temple itself is worth the visit, and the monkeys around it are bonus treat.Just make sure you don't open any food packages around them. They will definitely try to get a piece of whatever you were intending to eat...
historic. swayambhunath temple is one of the historic place to be visit, its religiously as well as naturally enriched !!
Gorgeous. views were stunning, I would definitely keep in touch with Dambar at Boundless Adventures and arrange the trip through him.The guest houses we stayed at along the way we're amazing.

A beautiful green temple at top of the hill. You can spend hours and hours in this temple as its on Top of a hill and whole Kathmandu is seen from the view points The temple in itself is have great architecture for both hindus and buddhisth Must see and having a half day will be more useful
Day out. Obviously Holy Shrine to go Awesome views as wellYou will surely enjoy your visitViewing Kathmandu from there and as a shrine of buddha there comes an awesome feeling

Not my cup of tea. I know some good people enjoy this place and go there every time they are in Kathmandu before and after the some strenuous solo trekking in the wilderness of Great Himalayas, but i have not liked it at all. I have not felt any positive energy or vibes in this place, felt dirty (but are not they all are in Kathmandu), with annoying agressive macaques (and i have seen plenty of macaques in my life) and the price is overwhelming (and not worth it at all). I would rather visit Boudnath stupa twice or go to Durbar.
A great place to visit.. One of the must visit places in Kathmandu. Monkey temple ! Have to ascend 100s of steps to reach on top. Monkeys throng the area making it very attractive.
Good . Me and my family been in this palace call shy ambulance stupa is really good to see kathmandu and cities

Also know as the Monkey Temple. Worth a visit even just for the amazing views of Kathmandu. Can see lots of monkeys, and there is even a monkey swimming pool which is very cute. Temple is stunning. There are a fair few stairs to keep in mind, not too difficult. There is a fee of NRP1000 (about USD$10).

Or the Monkey Temple. Great place to experience Hindu culture. Also known as Monkey temples where indeed monkeys can be found everywhere, unfortunately not so friendly as one might expect so watch out, better not to approach them! I travelled by car with the driver but there is an impressive alternative walking way through thousands of stairs to achieve the top which is probably worth the efforts.

Very nice attraction at Kathmandu because of the monkeys !!!. If you are the kind of the person that loves monkeys, this is the place to be. Very nice attraction but the monkeys make it unique. Tips to feed them: buy cookies from the first souvenir shop on the right as you get in to the attraction. A small package of cookies it cost, 50 Nepal rupees ($0.46). Do not have any sunglasses in your head or any hat etc. they will take it. Do not see in the eye - no eye contact, the monkeys that they carry babies with them. If you give them cookies, one by one and don't make the eye contact, it’s safe 100%. Do not give them the half package and try to save-hide the other. They will follow you and maybe they will attack on you to take it. Give them one by one, some of them they will wait to get 3-4 pieces and then they will leave. When the package it’s done, show them your hand, that is empty and you don't have any other cookies, they will leave :)

Best in Kathmandu. This is my second trip to Kathmandu and once again, the best place I have visited on my trip.Whilst not the biggest temple it has the most character when you visit it, especially if you take the stairs. The stairs aren't too bad and you get to see a lot of monkies on the way up, you also feel like you really earnt the good views at the top. Great place to sit, relax and view the city

Nice temple. This is an iconic temple in Kathmandu and I just love the eye that watches on as the country changes throughout the years. It is best to take your time to see all sides of this hill and to just chill whilst strolling around the complex. I am no fan of the monkeys though. Overall, popular with tourists and locals, you only get a few minutes of peace whilst there. Nevertheless, a nice spot to see the views of Kathmandu.
loved this place. I went twice during my visit to Kathmandu. make sure you explore both sides of the hill (and it's bases) as they both have very unique and interesting sculptures.

Beautiful structure . Such a beautiful place to visit. I enjoyed my walk from my hotel in Thamel. There was a steep stair climb which made arriving at the top all the more satisfying. It is quite touristic however. The monkeys were not as aggressive as I'd heard them to be. Great city view!
Great place. So nice, you basically get immersed in that place, surrounding yourself with people and different things

Lovely views at sunset and interesting temple. Lovely temple, though it needs some maintenance. Wonderful sunset view on a clear day, worth the walk up the hill. Some aggressive vendors at the bottom can taint the experience, but the temple is worth wading through them.

Well worth a visit if only for the views. We saw this temple in the distance whilst walking around the Thamel district of Khatmandu. We made our way there on foot without too much difficulty and did not regret making the effort.

Fantastic Experience. What a beautiful place, very spiritual as you would expect.
The monkeys jumping into the water is hilarious to watch.
There was some earthquake damage but this only adds to the atmosphere and shows the resilience of the people.

Beautiful place, poorly maintained. Like most heritage sites in Kathmandu, this is a gorgeous temple. Amazing views of the city from the top of the mountain. Unfortunately they could do better with the cleanliness. A must visit nevertheless. Taxi charged 300NPR from the base of the mountain to the temple.
Amazing view. Amazing view of the city. Good walk up more then 350 stairs. Lots to see up the top and little market stalls with jewellery and trinkets
Many steps. 365 steps up to this temple but well worth it. Lots of opportunities to buy singing bowls and monkeys are fun. But Stupa is lovely with great views over the city.
Peaceful Place. I visited this place and spent some time in peace. I recommend everybody visiting Nepal must go to this place.
Eyes of Eternity. Whether you are believer in something beyond this or not, this temple will make you sit back and think.

Swayambhunath Temple. A must see as the place is on a hill and gives an amazing view of the city. The climb from the front of the hill is lovely but we decided to take the lazy route and drove to the back of the hill where the climb and number of steps are not too much. Very nice shops on top of the hill. Lovely place to take pictures.

No Monkey Business . This was one of my favorite sites by far. As most have written the views are fantastic as is the general atmosphere! There is still damage from the earthquake and will be repaired slowly most likely. The monkeys are cool but can be aggressive.

Long way up to the top. Uncountable steps..... took us ages to reach. But reaching there made us forget it. Simple sober place to find peace....
Be here with the lord....and mesmerising beauty of the kathmandu valley.

It is worth to visit ... after Durbar sq and Pashupatnath. SWAYAMBHUNAT temple, Kathmandu. 3-4/ 5 On the top of an small hill, That gives you an enlarged view of the city. Stupa is amazing, but much more the families of monkies, ...like humans, discussing their rights. If you have short time, go first to Pashupatinath.

Beautiful. This place is fantastic. You can all of Kathmandu from the top and it totally worth the climb. The monkeys can be very cheeky and the shop owners and be very 'persistent'. When you reach the top I recommend taking the views whilst eating fresh mango. I also recommend, when it comes to shopping, to do the rounds beforehand. Some places will charge significantly more than others and if you see it somewhere else cheaper, you should say so and then they try and beat other prices. The views are breathtaking! This place is a must see!

By chanse on the right day. We visited the Temple on May 21st which was a good day. Buddhas birthday made the temple full but not too crowded. Still there is a lot of reconstruction after the earthquake in 2015 but still enough to see. As an added bonus for walking up the hill you get a terrific view of Kathmandu when the weather is good.

Swayambhunath, or the Monkey Temple, is worth the visit. A bit commercialised by all the vendors, this is still a worthwhile visit if you have more than a few days to see things in Katmandu. It is also a good hike up the hill if you have your cab or driver drop you off at the ring road. The Statues of the Buddha, inspiring, but watch out for the monkeys, especially if you buy food, drink or ice cream . They love to sneak up behind you and steal the food right out of your hand, or startle you into dropping your food. If you are looking for Nepali Handicrafts though, this is not the place to buy them, significantly overpriced.

Monkey Temple!!. I really enjoyed my visit to this Temple. Although is was raining cats and dogs, we managed to walk around and go to the top to enjoy the view, watch the monkeys, experience the culture, and buy some souvenirs and paintings from the shops that are on top.Its so colorful and beautiful and pictures look so nice with the small flags all around :-)

A breath of fresh air and some amazing views. I took the road at the back to allow for bikes to drive up to the entrance. It was such a nice experience walking around the gardens, climbing the stairs and seeing the views around Kathmandu. The monkeys all around are just delightful aswell.
Amazing Structure. One of the places you should visit when you are in Kathmandu. It's just a short taxi ride from Thamel.
Kathmandu City Tour. We had a very knowledgable local guide who showed us many wonderful historical sites around Kathmandu.

Wonderful Place for Photography. We had a chance to get wonderful photography here. It is simply a great place to snap pictures as you walk up the hill. You will be greeted by many monkeys in the process.
Good view. Top of the hill when you climb you sawing the great view hole city and sunrise with little lantang range fews mountains, a lots of minkeys, pilgrimes...good place chill out......

Breathtaking and must-see. Incredible site to behold, and lifted our spirits on a jampacked day-long itinerary. Fantastic views across the city, intricate artefacts and monkeys playing, all wrapped up in the multicoloured flag trails and refreshing breeze.
Top of the hill.. Is really nice place to see sun rise, sun set and view of the Katmandu valley ,Hindus and buddiest temple ,a lots of money...nice place around the are.

Magical place with great views over Kathmandu. Swayambhunath fortunately has not been damaged too much by the earthquakes. After climbing a long staircase, there is plenty to see and do. Fascinating place.

What a view. A stunning view over the entire city coupled with superb classic architecture and views of the surrounding mountains. Evening is marvellous. Take care with the monkeys by not carrying any food. Every visitor loves this place for mixture of Hindu and Buddhist culture. Good shopping here for slate carvings and prayer flags

Very Good place.. I was here last week.
This is a good temple related to buddhism mainly.
This temple is on a hill.
You can see a scenic beauty from here.
Must watch.

Wonderful peaceful place. Peaceful place with interesting temple, breathtaking view of ktm down the hill. Beware of the monkeys they can be agressive and go early in the morning to avoid the herd and the trinket sellers. Go with a local who knows the temple if possible lots of history you may miss alone.

Visit to Swayambhunath Temple . The visit to Swayambhunath Temple was very interesting. The place was partially destroyed by the earthquake, but the renovation work is going on. It does not hamper your visit and sightseeing at all. You get a great view of the Himalayas and the Kathmandu valley below. It is very lovely and worth visiting.

Monkey Temple. Holy stairs.... You will climb stairs for what feels like forever, but the views are totally worth it. Try to go after a rain so the sky is clear and just before sunset. Don't carry anything that looks like food in your hands because the monkeys will try to take it from you.

Vibrant hilltop stupa. We visited in the morning and walked the steps to the hilltop whilst the trinket sellers were still setting up. The reward for reaching the top is a rich complex of temples and the beautifully proportioned stupa. The monkeys and eagles, that circle overhead, add to the special location. Highly recommend a trip!
breath taking. found this temple very interesting and my tour guide was very informative. lots of history and art which takes me breath away

Worth the trek up the stairs. This is one of my favorite sites in Kathmandu, it was a good hike up the stairs, but that was half the fun with the monkeys and shrines on the way up. Once at the top the top the temple is beautiful and the view is breathtaking, if you can only see a few sights in Kathmandu, make this one of them,

Best plac to have a view of Kathmandu Valley. Being holy place of Buddhists people, anyone can travel either Hindu, Christian or Muslims. The atmosphere makes you feel peace when you have a look around.

Alot has changed since the 70s....like the view from Swayambhunath. When I lived in Nepal many years ago, it was a treat to bike/walk up to Swayambuth....mingle with the monkeys...look out to see KTM give way to green rice fields that stretched to the tree-filled hills leading to the mighty Himalayas. Now, it's basically City to the mountains....but still a breathtaking view and worthwhile experience.

One of the best places in Kathmadu. Swayambhunath is a beautiful place located on a hill with superb views of Kathmandu! Walking up is pleasant and you can bargain shop on your way up!! Shopping at the top as well. Take time to enjoy the view and explore. Suggest spending about 60-90 minute on the top. You can walk down other side where steps are steep - be careful.
Bisut. Me and my friend went to this temple , well interesting to see the monkeys all around, a little dirty but worth one visit just for curiosity .

Crimson Nepal Adventure. I recently visited Swayambhunath Temple in Kathmandu with by family. Dhana, our guide from Crimson Nepal Adventure, helped us to take an amazing walk through the local areas of Kathmandu. Eventually we reached this amazing celestial temple which held so much spiritual energy.

Special to be there. Peaceful and spiritual place where people walk around and around the temple. It feels special to be here. Walk and turn the prayer wheels. When we were here there was a group of women chanting and singing.

Have to visit!. The temple is located above a hill, which provides views of Kathmandu, the temple was not severely damaged by 2015 earthquake.Monkeys are not dangerous, lots of locals also go here for praying. Tickets are Rs 200, which is around 2 USD.
Swayambhunath Temple. A must see. I nice walk up through very interesting shops and restaurants. The vista and temples are very nice too. One of the highlights of Kathmandu.

Really worth visiting! . Definitely worth visiting! Try exploring all the pathways up to the top, we managed accidentally to visit it with out passing the ticket box! But even if you do pay its very cheap and great to see!

Worth visiting. Swayambhunath is definitely worth a visit. It's a beautiful temple with stunning views, and the long walk up is definitely worth it. There are many merchants and vendors at the top of the temple and near the entrances, who offer good prices for souvenirs and trinkets, and if you have gifts to buy, this is a good place to do it. Be aware of the monkeys - they are mostly calm, but not necessarily friendly, and will become aggressive if you try to pet them or get to close, especially to the baby monkeys. Also be aware of your possessions particularly food or drink bottles, as the monkeys WILL try to steal from you - often successfully.
Jai Swayambhu. A temple located in the hill top in Kathmandu. Visited there with my brother and found the place with peace and joyful. Nice view of the kathmandu valley from the temple.

Amazing place . Fantastic place, my favourite religious site in Kathmandu. Lots of stairs to get up there but once at the top the stupa is amazing and the surrounding area is filled with beautiful statues. Be sure to walk round behind and up to the monastery as the views and prayer flags here are just amazing.

Great View!. Have to walk up hill with steep stair but the view on top is worth climbing for! There are several souvenir shops and a few cafe and restaurant up there, so we could sit and enjoy the view of Kathmandu while drinking.

Monkey Temple of Kathmandu. The Buddhist temple of Swayambhunath also known as the Monkey Temple situated atop a small hill overlooking the sprawling Kathmandu city down below is an excellent viewpoint in Kathmandu valley.
