Most temples are dirty and the streets are a bit stinky ... a bit disappointed. For a great cultural experience in Kathmandu, prioritize Buddah temple (Bodnath stuppa) and the very culturally interesting crematoria at Pashupatinath.

Temple Hop. This was a nice temple fairly cheap compared to the other main attractions in Kathmandu. There were plenty of monkeys all over the temple premises. There was an impressive stupa at the top of the temple complex.

Beautiful. Another great place to visit, stunning architecture and lots of prayer wheels. Stunning views of Kathmandu from the top. You can also watch the monkeys throwing themselves into the pool. At 200 Nepali rupees each it is one of the more reasonably priced attractions in the Kathmandu valley.

Beautiful views. Worth the walk up all the stairs, it has beautiful views over the city and the temple is stunning. A taxi from Thamel to here is about 300-400 rupees. It costs 200 rupees to enter. There are delicious fresh coconuts and fruits to buy up the top, as well as ice cream and trinkets.

This is a must go place, feel and see the beauty of the religions. I like the atmosphere of this temple, and discover a lot of nepali come to worship regardless they are hindus or buddhist, very peaceful~
Colorful and moving. Worth a visit... cultural must. This is where you will see the people of Nepal in ritual. Side attraction... monkeys

Monkey temple Kathmandu. This temple situated in Kathmandu is a very attractive area, most important for the Buddhist pilgrim also for tourist visitors. Half hour by walk from center city it's impossible not visit this temple because is one of the most important for the all over Buddhists. I have visited this place in 2003 but the memory is always much alive one.
1,500 year old Tample. Nice view up hill. Interesting to know the myth about a monk/saint who cut her hair, the hair grown a tree & the lice became the monkey

Monkeys are Cool. I walked up from the Kathmandu side where there were less people. Walking up is definitely the better choice over taxi. Monkeys are great, just be careful about carrying monkey food unless you want them to take extra special attention to you.
Nice Temple, the views are great from top.. One of the excellent Temples to visit in Kathmandu. Nice to walk around the Stupa and see the beautiful views of the city

good place to visit. i liked that it is only 200 rupees to get in...unlike some other attractions in KTM...nice views, only thing i did not like was the touts that linger around for single tourists...not sure what they wanted, since i dont talk to anyone who approaches me.LOL Cool monkeys everywhere..but be careful..they sometimes attack ! LOL

Nice place, should not be more touristy. It was nice to walk araound the Stupa, turning prayer wheels enjoying the spiritual spirit. This spirit is however in danger to be washed away by too much tourist, thops, guides...
Many steps and monkeys!. Wonderful views of Kathmandu from the top! To enter, must climb either 100 steps from the back or 365 steps from the front. Beautiful Stupa.

View from the top is excellent.. Do climb up all the way - The view from the top is excellent and totally worth it. The details on the temple are excellent and represent a cultural mix of Buddhism and Hinduism - Very beautiful (I've attached some photos)
PS: beware of Monkeys :)

Unique points. Very nice sight seeing point
From where you can see the holl kathmandu valley sight seen.....and great monastery of buddha.

Inner Peace. Located at the top of a hill. You can have complete view of the beautiful Kathmandu Valley from here, which is breathtaking experience. The environment up there is so serene that you will be at inner peace. If you are in Kathmandu, this place should not be missed. Approach road is a bit bumpy at some places. Beware of monkeys, they may snatch eatables from your hand. Taking the services of tour guide is also not recommended, as you are not here for history lessons....

Incredible Energy...Incredible Place!!!!. This is one of the Temple you have to visit once in Kathmandu as well as others...Located on a high point in the city, this complex of temples and shrines gives the better and the most breathtaking views of the city. Knowned as the Monkey Temple (you see why), it's one of the most beautiful stupa in Kathmandu. Incense, Monkeys, Music, people, flags....and amazing and spectacular views of kathmandu. Worh a lot, a visit!!!

wonderful. the view that it overlooks over the kathmandu valley.so much has changed though but still great. Different feeling when you go up there early morning or during the evenings. Lots of tibetan peoples doing the kora ,good to watch.

PANORAMIC VIEW OF KATHMANDU CITY. Also known ad monkey temple due to all of the wild monkeys that are around. They don't bother anyone and are fascinating. The shrines and temples are stunning and the view from the top of the hill where the temple sits is stunning.

Excellent view of Kathmandu!. Beware of the monkeys! This place is crawling with them! But besides that, this place offers an excellent view of Kathmandu. Most taxis will offer to wait at the entrance once you're done so there is less fuss about getting out. Take your time wandering around, there is plenty to see and a lot to buy :)

Monkey Temple. One of the holiest sites for buddhists - but a bit of a market at the same time. Amazing views of KTM from atop this stupa. Great place to kora & build merit. Monks doing puja & chanting, tourists everywhere & views forever. Fantastic place but could do without the tourist shops everywhere - felt unauthentic & materialistic. What would Buddha say!?

deserve climbing a long stairs. The temple is located on a hill, so you have to climb a quite long stairs to get there. But it deserves it!You can have a look at the whole Kathmandu from the temple. Many locals come here and show there respect to the god.

a real experience. You can see hinduist and boudist people praying together. There is no problem between Shiva religion and Boudha religion. It is at the top of a mountain so you can take a loof of Kathmandu.

A place must go when you are in Nepal. This is slightly less popular than other temples, but to get the essence of Hindu culture for simple life with out fear ,,you must visit, This place also less crowed and you have spectacular views, help you to recognize yourself, do not expect the place clean as 5 star hotel. Must go

Local Monkey Temple. I enjoyed this shrine despite the monkey poop. I'll just get that out of the way now.Luckily you can keep your shoes on.There is a small entrance fee. As you enter there is a small fountain with a statue and bowl. Buy some coins and try to toss into the bowl for luck or wish. Its fun and addictive. The temples area has many colourful flags that make for some great photography. There are two hills for temples here. On the way up and at the top there are people selling the typical souvenirs you have seen everywhere in Kathmandu. While the monkeys are a nuisance and can be aggressive they are not the mass colonies as some other places. Still do not leave anything unattended or in their reach or it will be stolen.On clear days there are some nice views of the city. At the top the stupa is well adorned and smaller shrines surrounding the stupa. This temple has a mix of flavours. It should only take about 1 hour to see everything here.There are some places to eat here.
Unclean place. the views are good, but when a place of worship is unclean, it kind of ruins the mood. That is what happened when we reached here.
One of the best places in Kathmandu. Turists have to pay but not much, I think it was 200 Rupies (2 Dollars). Cool place. One of the best places in Kathmandu.

One of top attractions of Kathmandu. A beautiful temple situated on top of a hill. You'll get a beautiful view of the city. We took a walk from Kathmandu, it takes about an hour but do-able. Climbing the stairs might be hard, but if you feel tired, just stop and enjoy the views.
bad staff. the gate staff is quite rude there- this was my third time and my experiecne has always been the same
monkey temple. located on a hill, it oversees kathmandu with its big stupa and monasteries. Also lots of monkey to be seen.

Most beautiful sight from the top of hill whee the temple is,. Went in taxi, while going and climbed down the stairs , while returning. That was great experience climbing down 365 steps, first few steps are real difficult they are steep, , monkeys all around, a child wanted to play with a monkey , got hurt a bit when the monkey hit her on head. Nothing serious , the child was bit upset. Never miss this Buddhist temple while in Kathmandu.

Peaceful and scenic. Have been going here since I was a kid (I mostly grew up in Kathmandu) and I've always enjoyed Swoyambhu though the monkeys still scare me! Good excercise- you need to climb the stairs to get to the top. There are two sets of stairs- one's a little steep so make sure you know which one you're choosing! I fing the stories of why the temple was built fascinating and the story of the white cave there too! I can't remember what the building's called but you'll pass it on your way to the top. They say there are several doors *one after the other to lead you deeper inside the building/cave) in there and only the outer 2 or 3 doors are open because the hermit who entered this place about a century ago is still inside praying. I also love the buddhist music from the stalls and shops, it adds more to the environment and makes you feel all peaceful.
Beautiful views. The ambience at the temple was very nice with people chanting since it was a festival day. It's not very well maintained, which is a real shame since it's very beautiful.

Wonderful. It's one of these places that just makes you feel alive.. and leaves you feeling grateful that you made it there. Climbing up the stairs with monkeys frolicking around and taking in the gorgeous views of the mountains is so enjoyable. The vibe at the top of the hill, in the temple, was amazing. I loved every second.

365 steps. ...took me about 20 minutes, and then 200 NR at the top as an entrance fee. It's got a big stupa, famous for Buddha's eyes, and a great panorama of Kathmandu laid out below. They are currently doing remodelling work, but it won't interfere with the experience. It's often referred to as the "monkey temple" but frankly I was not impressed by the handful of rhesus (?) monkeys--you want to see a monkey temple, go to Ubud, Bali!There is a monastery or two there, and they sell thanka paintings. Sadly, there are dozens of other merchants selling cheap, mass-produced junk, and some are quite aggressive about it. This rlevel of commercialism really distracted me from the serenity of the place.

Charming Stupa nice views. This located at a height gives charming views of Kathmandu City, the place is quiet with a few shopkeepers selling very good paintings and handicrafts. You can sit relax, pray to the divinity and of course click some nice pictures.Most intresting is a Monkey Pond, where ,monkeys come and swim take bath and play...its really funny.Worth a place.

If you need some rest, go there.. Entrance fee is only 200R and you can spend hours there. You can walk there from the thamel (be prepared for climbing to the hill) or take a taxi (300R) Thamel. If you are there, watch monkeys in swimming pool. One of the funniest monkeys I ever seen. They jump to the water and swimming there. Climb up, feel power of the place and enjoy beautiful view to Kathmandu. During a full moon there is nice ceremony. If you are in Kathmandu and need some rest, go there.

Lots of Stairs, Many Monkeys. We walked up from the eastern entrance. Many stairs, 200R entrance, very nice views from the top. There are vendors along the way, and several shops around the stupa. A few cafés, too, although we did not eat there. Be careful if you have any food, as there is no arguing with a monkey who wants what you have. There were many baby monkeys when we were there, so that was fun.
Great view up there. I enjoyed climbing stairs . They are many and I had to take rest for couple of minutes while going up but it deserves the effort as its nice up there and the view is beautiful .

New Experience. The same day we arrived to Nepal. After checked in to the hotel, we started our tour in Kathmandu. This was our first step. Monkey Temple or Swayambunath Temple. Rupees 200 entrance fees. When in start with a wish pool. People hardly through coins to the pool and wish. Many statues with different shapes. Our driver tried hard to explain us but his English was very poor. So many things to see and take pictures. Many places to buy memorial books and gifts but it's all overpriced. Monkey everywhere one step from you but innocent. When you reach to the top of the temple, you can have a great look to the city.It's really nice experience.

Watch out for the monkeys. Start at the large gold statues of Lord Buddha and then wind your way along the path to the start of the temple complex. It is Rs 200 for foreigners, about $2 USD and buy a ticket at the counter. See the wishing well, watch out for the monkeys, and walk up the steps to the main part of the complex. There are stupas, shops, and restaurants. You can easily spend an afternoon here if you linger.

365 steps to superb views. Worth to go go at winter, because views, however, anytime that nice, atmosphere is special. Somebody told masculine or feminine , - I messed up - compare to Boodhanath. Yes, female energies.

Also called monkey temple. You can choose to let you drop off at the bottom , but be aware you have to walk many many steps.The other way is to let you drop off on the hill and you have a few steps to go.Also here more renovations are done and it looks more and more perfect
Monkeys. A lot of monkeys walking around. The temple was only 200 rupees to enter. Worth checking out if you are in the area. It was very small, smaller than I thought. But a great view of Kathmandu.
good view. Nice but dirty place. You have a nice view over Kathmandu and will see many monkeys. It is take the stairs all the way to the stupa in stead of taking a taxi.

Swoyambhunath Stupa. The world’s most glorious Buddhist Chaityas built 2000 years ago is situated on a hillock about 77 meter above the level of Kathmandu valley. Visitors will also have a grand view of the valley from this spot.

A Must Visit. The temple is gorgeous. The best part is that you have a 360 degree view of Kathmandu from here.
You will be required to climb say about 250 steps but completely worth it.
Most Peaceful. One a beautiful hill stop, with a beautiful view of Kathmandu and surrounding landscape combined with spiritual bliss.

Swayambunath Temple. Good to spend some time. Peaceful and worth the visit. The vendors encourage you to buy eatables for monkeys and the monkeys look forward from every visitor something to eat. Avoid buying and the monkeys avoid you, anything in hand they expect you to share with them. Be careful with cameras and mobiles.very hot during a sunny day but good to take photos. The city looks nice from the top and you get varieties of arts and crafts with local artists exhibiting their skill. Feel free to bargain and buy.Worth spending the time. The rest rooms are supposed to be free for tourists, willingly give them some money or ignore them if they demand money raising their voice.

Historical place. Symbhunath is one of the historical place of Nepal.Where many Buddhist religious people visits every year. From there you can see almost half of kathmandu valley. This temple is surrounded all side by forest so whenever you go there you will feel free from your problems and get relax. You can see there hostorical and religious things . Visit once one in your life
Good work out. Perched up high is the magnificent Temple with lots of monkeys, vendors and tourists alike.Good Views across the Capital

A Little Heaven Above The City.. I come here every time I visit Kathmandu — because it is a little escape from the city to slow down, to relax, to contemplate, imagine and pray. I usually go all the way to the back and enter from here to have a more peaceful and harmonious entry into this sacred place.Swayambhu offers sweeping view of the valley to connect better with your favorite location from a bird-eye perspective.Stupa is a perfect place to increase one's merit (mind positive energy) through circumambulation and turning prayer wheels for everyone's benefit. Also there's a real Gompa where one can light up the candles to brighten the thinking of all beings. It is a very cool place to hang out for whatever reason, even to do some people-watching. It is a little heaven above Kathmandu.

Must must visit. One of the two most sacred Stupas of the Kathmandu Valley..many legends of the origin of the Stupa..that it arose by itself... It is hard climb up but worth it...great view if the weather is clear..watch your stuff around the monkeys...several troops live here and documentaries have been filmed about them... Go clockwise around....wonderful place !

Amazing View of Kathmandu!. Attraction Worth visiting but only before 4pm. Make sure your going there with taxi only coz its too far and , no road only holes it was like im going on dune bashing , when we reach up there was so many monkeys so be careful what you carry in your hands and soooo many dogs that were aggressive.The beauty of the place on other hand it is unbelievable. It is smaller than Boudhah Stupa , but definitely different . There was very peaceful athmosphere as the monks were saying prayers and people were sitting and singing songs in the name of Buddha and the view of Kathmandu from the top was breathtaking. If you are there up during the day i would recommend to take the stairs down so you can see the nice sculptors around.

a world in itself. A great walk, a meditative experience and apparently very good for your karmic balance ... if you think wonderful thoughts as you go, which is not difficult ! a microcosm of Buddhism, Nepali customs, Central Asian culture and the hustle and bustle of the city lapping at the base of the stupa. A truly magic place, not to be missed !
Amazing view, fabulous architecture. Fantastic place if you are interested in history, religion, culture and views! Definitely going back!
Decent temple but not well maintained. You will undoubtly see some playful monkeys there but the temple in itself is not exceptional. Avoid eating there as there are no good options.
Monkeys!!!. If you enjoy being around monkeys, and want to feed them some ice cream, this is the place for you, you're basically in a natural circus...

The Monkey Temple. Well worth visiting. A fantastic view of Kathmandu from the top. Even using a taxi it is a load of stairs but worth it, Stupa and temples. The stores are full of Tonkas, slate and wood carvings. Really fun sitting and watching the monkey population jumping in the water pool.....

Breathtaking View of Kathmandu Valley. We walked from Kanthpur temple house, Thamel.. It took us approx 45 minutes and then 365 steps to reach top of the temple.... It is indeed worth.. The view of Kathmandu valley is phenomenal... Best time to visit is early morning...

Another for the list. I was fortunate enough to visit the temple on a clear sunny day. The views were spectacular over the city but keep hydrated.There are so many facets to this location. Plenty to see and experience, the beauty, prayer flags reaching from hill top to hill top.You can walk from the bottom or park near the top. Although parking there is difficult like most of Nepal.The only thing that spoils the site is the trash that litters the hill top.

Ecclectic Mix of Spirituality. Swayambhunath (also known as the monkey temple) sits above Kathmandu and affords some great views out over the city. It's a real mixture of both Buddhism and Hinduism. The individual representations of each are stunning with a vibrancy of colour and a real sense of peace. It can get congested and if you go on a warm day make sure you have some bottled water with you.

Fabulous temple. You can see many monkeys.So it's also called Monkey temple.If you show them something to eat, especially sweets like Jelly or Candy, they will try to rob it from you.They are really fast and swift so be careful you may hurt.And they fight each other because of the foods that you give them.Mothers fight each other to take the food that you throw away, so that they can feed their babies.So if you don't wanna make them fight, don't give them sweets.It's really high up in the hill so you can see a nice view of Katmandu.In real you can see the whole city haha.There is an entrance fee, but you can't notice it until you go upstair.It's Nepalees' strategy to take you upstair so that you can't give up to stop by this temple.It's not expensive so just pay them and enjoy yourself with a fabolous view.

Unique experience. The temple is part of a complex with graves/cemeteries, statues, monk residences and temples where people, monkeys, baggers and souvenir salesmen hang out. While listening to the monks chanting, the site provides an amazing view of Kathmandu from the top of the hill. Amazing experience, a must if you're in Nepal!

Breathtaking. All the Buddhist temple is just mesmerizing to visit. The Stupa, the Buddha's eyes! Just magnificent. If you are able to, walk up the 365 steps to the temple, it believes to give you good luck all year round. 35 mins walk from Thamel, we found it easily and had a good day out.The views are well worth climbing up the stairs, as is the peaceful complex.

Worth a visit. Arrange to see this Temple whilst you are in Kathmandu, it's one hell of an unique landmark dedicated to Buddah with his all seeing eyes, an iconic symbol of the Temple. Pay attention to genuine Buddist pilgrims who may have spent weeks trekking to get there and respect them, your a tourist, they are devout pilgrims so visit with reverence and respect. Plenty of shops within the complex and there is an entrance fee. Go with an organised group with an official guide and it's worth the money, nothing worse coming half way across the world to see something and going away not having a clue about it. this Temple is one of many fine attractions that Nepal and Kathmandu has to offer and do your best to see as many as possible. Can get crowded at times, but you are in Asia, it's densely populated and that's it.
top of Kathmandu city. The panoramic view of Kathmandu city can be seen from swayambhunath. Here Buddhists and Hindus worship side-by-side in the name of god.

A divine place. Swayambhunath Temple is a good place to visit. A supremely sacred place of Buddhism. A kind of peace in the air. Buddhist chanting and candles in front of Huge Buddha statue are some of the highlight of this place. Beware of monkeys at this hilly place..
Lovely and serene. The visit was so well organised by my associate that I spent a full 2 hours admiring the serenity and respecting the sanctity of the place. It was worth a visit.

Eciting and interesting. There are great views to Kathmandu valley. For me was interesting to see the blessing ritual which one of the holy man committed to purge the unhappy people. There lives many monkeys and they are funny.

Spectacular Views... Mountains and Monkeys. Swayambhunath (Swaymbu) or more commonly known as "The Monkey Temple" is a favorite of Kathmandu tourists... This temple complex offers spectacular views of the entire Kathmandu Valley (for those willing to brave the climb). Monkeys run free on the complex and are a fun addition to the visitor's experience. Beautiful art galleries at the top where oil and canvas paintings of Nepal mountains and landscapes can be purchased.

Magnificent city view from the temple. A place you should not miss out. The temple is up the hill. From the temple, u can have the whole city view from the temple. However despite the fact that there is a board written "toilet is free" for foreigner, I was asked to pay.

A must visit in Kathmandu valley. The panoramic view of Kathmandu city is something awesome. monkeys are so fun. Temple itself and the museum worth visiting. Not far from Kathmandu city centre. I grabbed a taxi from Thamel and it was completely safe to move around alone. I spent a quick one hour but would have stayed more than 3 hours if time permitted.
Picturesque...Enchanting. Definitely worth visiting...From the height worth seeing the city. Could not visit the Anandvan. It's a popular destination with well managed garden.
Monkey temple, well named. Beautiful architecture, swarming with monkey families and tourists and those trying to make money off tourists from wealthy countries.
Arial view of Kathmandu. No god is seen there but vie is very good you have to climb quite some steps to get there and paying entry fee for which purpose it is used god only knows

A must-do!. Otherwise known as the "Monkey Temple', Swayambhunath is absolutely gorgeous and is a must-do for visitors to Kathmandu. We went very early in the morning (about 5.30am) and the temple was busy with walkers, joggers, runners and karate kids exercising! I have to admit I struggled with all the steps, but the view from the top of Kathmandu Valley is definitely worth the climb! What's really interesting about this temple is that Buddhists and Hindus worship side-by-side. Loved seeing all the baby monkeys so close up! I would definitely recommend a visit.
Monkeys Woo. Nice temple. Good vibes. Busy. Great views! Monkeys are fun. Friendly spot. is this 50 characters yet???

Kathmandu City Panorama. Complete panorama view of Kathmandu City. Beautiful traditional and natural park with a lot of religious statues. Monkey families. Touristic shops. Fantastic sunset. Important Stupa for people. Must to see

A must do in Kathmandu. The temple at the top has spectacular views of the valley. There are lots of monkeys and they will be within a few feet of you. The stupa at the top is impressive. There are lots of vendors selling souvenirs. One warning: There is a Thangka painting "school" at the top. Your guide (if you have one) may tell you that its a good school and, in confidence, explain that a 20% discount on the price is good. The person in the store will serve water and explain the painting process (which is interesting). However, the prices are highly inflated and probably quadruple what things cost in Thamel. I suspect the guides get a kickback for bringing people to the Thangka store/school. They do have a lot of painting but don't buy unless you are familiar with how Thangka paintings are priced.

Swayambhunath Temple. A shortish walk from Thamel up to the top of the hill and up the stairs to the temple. You pass through various areas of Kathmandu on the way where you can buy almost anything from the friendly shopkeepers and see the problems of sanitation when crossing the river.

great view of KTM. I'm not a big temple visitor on my travels, but this was a good visit. Nice walk out to temple - take a map though, you can get muddled before you cross the river. Go on a clear day if possible for the best view of the area.Careful eating outside, we found the monkeys tried to take our food and got aggressive when we tried to dismiss them.

Place of peace. Amazing place where you can see a beautiful view almost for the whole city. It is really worth to visit. It could be little bit hard to get there from the stairs if you are not in a good shape =) but monkeys will follow you all the way.

It's a great spot to see some monkeys and a nice temple. The temple is atop a large hill that requires a few breathers to complete, otherwise you can take your taxi around to the left of the stairs and up the side of the hill and remove the stair climb. I however advise the climb as the views as you ascend are the best of Kathmandu.

365 steps to heaven. after climbing the 365 stairs of this temple meeting lots of pilgrims on the way you arrive in a sort of boudha heaven with sweet music and aromatic scents Overwelming and emotional and what a view over the city I knew it right there this is where i would by my boudha statue to take home

A Good Climb. The climb to the top is all worthwhile. Just make sure you return via the same stairway, otherwise, you would end up at a different side of the square (Which is quite a long walk away)
At the top, you would get a scenic view of the city.
Spiritually touching. Look for a lovely lady who offers Tibetan bowl therapy.. A wonderful experience in a holy place.. Lie down and relax to the singing bowls
Nice attraction. We visited this place in Kathmandu during our recent visit. Interesting site . We liked the place it's an interesting location

Monkey Temple - worth a visit. Beautiful views of the city from this hilltop temple with free-roaming monkeys so hold onto your belongings. It's a very steep climb so take a taxi up instead especially in the heat of the summer! Lots of photo taking opportunities and worthwhile to stop off at the bottom for the beautiful golden statues.

Two Eyes In the Top of Hill. Swayambhunath Temple (monkey temple) is lies in the middle of Kathmandu.This place is most exciting place to visit in kathmandu from where you will see wholekathmandu city. Stupa in the Top of hill with two eyes makes me feel like stupa is watchingwhole city every second. this place is the identity of Buddha (light of Asia) and hindu gods.lots of stairs to clime up and lots of monkeys around the stupa. this is the place of Beauty and Nature lots of trees and temple with more then Hundreds of Gods stupa.Highly recommend to everyone to visit this beautiful Place.

A place to visit. There are two ways to the temple one in the front and one back..the front one will take you up a huge number of stairs while the back entrance just a few..under the scorching sun I decided the back entrance and it was really quick and easy..The place has a lot of monkeys and going up the stairs to the top you will have a great view of the city..
Few monkeys. This temple has a reputation for monkeys. However, I spotted less than 10 during my visit. Watching the local devotees worshipping the deities was an eye-opener.

Up in the clouds surrounded by holy chants. Love the entire atmosphere of reverence. Wish I could have seen the much touted view but it was too cloudy. Those steps up to the stupa are a real workout!!

Known as Monkey Temple also.. It has 365 steps to climb but you can see the view of Kathmandu Valley from its top. The stupa is big. Monkeys can take away youe eats from hand. The west entrance with parking lot, you can save climbing only 100 steps.

Monkey temple lives it up!!. Aptly called Monkey temple in Kathmandu. Large monkeys lazing around giving the camera lens some good clicks. Colored flags flapping in the light breeze soothing and calming the nerves. Swayambhunath eyes boring into you from the high perch and the view of Kathmandu city spread out in front of you, makes this site a must visit and despite the crowd, a must visit place...

"wow". Nice temple. people are worshipping there with faith. love architecture. there is a lot of small shops from where you can purchase a lot many things, but do a lot of bargaining because the prices they say are just three times then what they give.
Amazing place. Budh Swayambhunath Temple is on the high , overlooking the city . What a spiritual place. A place to visit if u travel kathmandu. Liked it and will visit again , on my next visit .

Great view of Kathmandu. This is a great morning or evening trip in Kathmandu. The temple itself is Buddhist but feels like a combination of Buddhism and Hinduism which is typical in Nepal. The stairs that lead up to it can be hot mid day (thus the early or late trip) and are surrounded by frolicking monkeys (thus the name the "Monkey Temple"). The stupa is surrounded by prayer wheels and statues (and monkeys). The view of the city from here is terrific. Beware of eating or drinking with the monkeys around, they WILL jump you!

the stairs re too high. Nice place to see whole Kathmandy in one almost 300 degree view. But the stairs...they kill you! And when it is a middle of the day you will probably die of natural causes! And monkey who jump and bite you, craziness! Admission fee is another "lovely" present after a long sweaty climbing. On average it was ok to spend some time there. recommended :)

A sight to see. An amazing place and well worth the trip. Like many of the temples in Nepal, this is crowded with people but it all adds to the experience. There is shopping from locals abound and some amazing photo opportunities.

Beautiful view of the Kathmandu Valley. It had such a beautiful view of the Kathmandu Valley, and in such a spiritual place, too! It is worth it to climb the stairs to the top, because you are rewarded with all that the stupa has to offer and more.

Great view, beautiful temple. you can climb to the temple from two different directions. Both are nice. Be careful of the monkeys they are aggressive. Be careful of buying overpriced souveniers sold by pushy vendors. Be careful of guides that impose their services on you and expect money at the end.

Worth the visit. Perched atop a hill on the western edge of the Kathmandu Valley, the ancient Swayambunath Stupa is worth a visit.The all-seeing Buddha eyes that stare out from the top.There are many shrines and statues which are added attraction to the tourists.I enjoyed my visit. There are many attractions here.

Outstanding views!. This was a fun site to take in. I loved it for the structure/history itself, the view and the monkeys. It can be easy to feel some fatigue at the number of temples to take in and sea of vendors around the city (and temples), but I found this to be a calm setting and lots to see/take in. True, as others mention, beware of the monkeys - but in my experience if you keep to yourself, monkeys will do the same. There is the option to climb up & down, or just down (and probably not at all) - so if this is a consideration in your travels, it might be a site to consider.

Lots of monkeys and dogs. Swayambhunath is similar in appearance with Boudanath temple. It's a nice place but there were lots of monkeys and dogs inside swayambhunath. Beware of monkeys. You can get the view of the whole city from the top. When u see the temple from the ground (below the stairs) its seems to be huge but when u actually climb the stairs, the temple is quite small. Entrance fee of 50 Nepali rupee per person (for indian tourist) has to be paid and it's more for foreign tourists.

Worth The Visit. I liked the temple so much that I visited it twice. The first time I was able to watch a live prayer session. Both times I visited it rained so that kept the number of people to a minimum. Definitely walk up the main entrance with the 365 step approach to the temple.

Svayambunath. Imagine how it was without thousands of tourists - and when even white skinned people dis not have to pay to visit the holy place of the Buddha. Nevertheless on some spots the vibes of true religion can still be felt
Eyes and Monkeys. The eyes on the stupa are fascinating and is a great photo opp. I also loved the monkeys especially the babies.
Visit at the Buddist temple. The experience a\was very good. Huge structure. So many restaurants and hotels around. Clean environment

So worth it. A 3 dollar taxi ride will take you to this special place. Throwing Nepali coins in the fountain will start the experience. Navigating through the stupas is very surreal. This is. Must see,

Beautiful views from the main platform. Also known ad monkey temple due to all of the wild monkeys that are around. They don't bother anyone and are fascinating. The shrines and temples are stunning and the view from the top of the hill where the temple sits is stunning.

Must see. A short climb up the hill but once you've reached the top, it's almost like being in another world. There are a number of temples around the biggest stupa. Tibetan prayer bells and flags all over the place create a magical atmosphere. The view of the city from the top is also very good.

Interesting, busy and Ancient. There is a lot going on at Swayambhunath. Beautiful old architecture. Lots of monkeys to laugh at. A small Buddhist monastery and a fantastic single stone sculpture. Amaxing 365 step staircase.

Must Visit. One Of The Place, Where We Have To Climb 100 Of Stairs To Reach The Top.
Very Soothing, Best View in The City Of The City.

aka "Monkey Temple"!. A highlight of the city tour, for sure! Get past the monkeys and you'll see a cool Stupa and lots of surrounding memorials and shrines! It was my 2nd day in Kathmandu and it was eye candy. So much to look at, and learn! We had a great city guide through Himalayan Glacier Trekking and he brought it all to life!

temple surprise. sitting in a green area by the river it is a surprising oasis within the huge city of Kathmandu. I did not expect much and was pleasantly surprised by the visit. definitely a must see in Kathmandu.

Must visit.. The view is great. It is an experience like no other. It is peaceful and it is a place highly revered. It can also be seen from the 9 storeyed house.Make sure you ask for the wishing will and throw in a coin!

Breathtaking. All the Buddhist temple is just mesmerizing to visit. The Stupa, the Buddha's eyes! Just magnificent. If you are able to, walk up the 365 steps to the temple, it believes to give you good luck all year round.

Swayambhunath a Buddhist temple. Said to be around 2000 years old, this Buddhist Stupa sits atop a hill. The main stupa is composed of a solid hemisphere of brick and earth supporting a lofty conical spire crowned by a pinnacle of Copper gilt. Painted on the four sided base of the spire are the all seeing eyes of Lord Buddha. The hill of Swayambhunath is a mosaic of small Chaityas and Pagoda temples. You’ll get a scenic view of Kathmandu city from there.

Stupa on a hill. This was my second time to visit "The Monkey Temple" - and not as many monkeys as four years ago! Some days the pollution is bad and you can not see much from the top, but when you can, you have a great view.If you arrive by car you are taken to an area with a flight of steps up, but there is a steep way down the bottom with many more steps. Lots of traders lining the route up.

The vantage point for photographers. It is situated at probably the highest-point in Kathmandu. You will love it if you are a photographer because you get 360-degree view of Kathmandu valley: a breathtaking view it is! Around October November, when the "rainy" season recedes and when Nepal welcomes autumn, it is perhaps the best time: you feel that refreshing cool breeze passing through your ear, yet it is warm and sunny. At the same time, the view from top, the serene sound of Buddhist monks chanting; you can just sit there and let the life pass you by- the peace, the connection with your inner soul!WARNING: Beware of monkeys! TIPS:You'll be climbing steep steps (thousands of steps!). If you've asthma or some breathing problem, don't forget your nebuliser/inhaler.Do not forget your camera and the lived one(s)

Monkey Temple. Entrance Fee 200 Rupees. Good place to visit, it is a large complex, so easily you can spend here 2 hours, great views of the city, some people recommend to come to this place at the sun set.... I do not agree. be carefull with the monkeys they are wild animals and they are agressive, acting like a gang.Tip, if you go there after 6 pm is free ! they close the ticket office and you can go for free.It is a walking distance from Thame area, around 40 minutes, so there is no need to take a taxi.

Chhetrapati/Dhibichaur walk to Swayambhu is great. Walking to 'the Monkey Temple' continues to be one of the best free things to do in Kathmandu.There are important local things to see and participate in along the way: local markets, and crucial for travelers: affordable and good health care.Chhetrapati Free Clinic is at the Chhetrapati Chowk. It's not always free to 'foreigners,' but the doctors are excellent (Dr. Joshi, the ENT specialist, for example).There's a pharmacy attached, where I trust the medicines are authentic. The local eateries are also safe and good.In nearby Dhalko, Noor Opticals fitted me with bifocals with high-quality slightly tinted plastic lenses for $45. The testing equipment is new; results were quick and reliable. (I'm 65 so this matters...) Monu, 9803844363.Further on this recent walk, I stumbled on a funeral procession--something that was common to see in KTM 10 years ago. The pall bearers (indigenous Buddhists) headed toward a Tibetan gonpa (monastery) and invited me to sit with them to see the cremation ceremony. Since i'm a philosophical type, that was a great thing. It rained buckets and the ceremony lasted 6 hours. I was very happy. The walk from KTM to Swayambhu is a route that many Nepali processions use. I encourage you to at least see them. Don't be invasive or take photos. Happy trails!

Good place to start your Nepal experience. A good place to start appreciating Nepal when you arrive in Kathmandu. Take a taxi (500 rupees from Thamel) and ask to be taken to the "Monkey Temple". After your insane drive thru the city, you will then walk up MANY steps to this important Buddhist stupa and temple. Enjoy the breathtaking views of Kathmandu from the top. Walk CLOCKWISE around the stupa. Take pictures of the monkeys and temple dogs. Buy a few things from the vendors - don't forget to haggle. Get into the spirit of the "Om Mani Padme Hum" mantra. Exit from the gate on the opposite side from which you came. No worries - there is a taxi stand awaiting. Welcome to Nepal!!!!
A must see in Kathmandu. Nice place, great views of the city and plenty of monkeys to keep you entertained... What more do you need! Oh and a pretty beautiful temple!

Its the most beautiful place in KTM.. Just fell in love with the place. Its quite the climb but the view OMG. U can see the whole of KTM for the top. U can just sit there for hours enjoying the view and the peace of the place. Visited by thousands of ppl everyday. U can see young monks juggling that bunch of rubber bands kinda ball with their feet in the evening. Theirs a restaurant to the side tat serves lovely momos and coffee. Real beautiful place

A destiny for Buddhists..... A must be visited religious site for Buddhist. Life is not complete unless a Buddhist visits Swaymbhunath Temple, a uniquely located temple..... a rare opportunity on earth.
Great day out. 35 mins walk from Thamel, we found it easily and had a good day out.The views are well worth climbing up the stairs, as is the peaceful complex.

Refresh. I make myself ready to go Swayambhu anytime. In the morning, u feel good seeing hundreds of joggers and devotees, in the noon, u mean majestic and photographic and in the evening and night time, it looks like a palace, golden palace. May Buddha flourish in your thoughts.

The Monkey Temple. Swayambhunath Temple is an interesting Buddhist attraction, it is the remains of what was once a temple, now filled with monkeys and markets around to buy nice traditional Nepalese and Tibetan arts and crafts, has a nice view of the city as well.

A lot of steps and a good view. Interesting temple with great views across Kathmandu as long as the smog has cleared. There are the usual shops, beggars, monkeys and food places and it was worth a visit. Our taxi driver waited for us and it was worth the time and cost

Astonishing View. The entire build up to the destination is an absolute beauty and it gets astonishing the moment you reach the place. An enchanting beauty of culture and magnificent view of the entire city makes your efforts of reaching the place worth it.

Cultural Experience. We went in the evening, and crowds nearly made us turn around. Once we started the steps, it thinned, though, and we thoroughly enjoyed the view, the stupa and surroundings once we were on top. The Kathmandu haze and pollution obviously doesn't give you maximum views, but still it was worth it. Went down the back steps and took a taxi from there.I think we enjoyed this more than later the Bodnath Stupa.

Awesome. This is one of the most fascinating places we have been on our travels! The views are amazing, it's nice and quiet and it's a culture buffs dream! Also it's hard to take a bad photo whilst your up there! The monkeys too are pretty awesome! If a little scary! Well worth 250NPR and half a day of your time!

Watch out for the Monkeys!. This is definitely worth the steep climb - you will be charged the tourist rate for entry, and if you want to buy anything, like water. At least they're upfront about it (!). The monkeys (for the which Swayanbhunath gets it nickname, the 'monkey temple') really are a grumpy bunch. We saw one nearly make off with a woman's shopping. So, amusing to watch, but approach with caution.Follow the prayer flags to the top, and you will be rewarded by incredible views, and both Buddhist and Hindu places of worship side-by-side; why can't other religions get along so well?On the way down we saw a Buddhist funeral, which was quite moving; totally different attitude to life/death, than in the west.Don't leave Kathmandu before a visit!

Nice place but watch for the monkeys!. Nice place and of course you have to pay unless you're from Nepal. I was told it's cheaper for Saarc countries (Pakistan, India etc) because Nepal was allies with saarc countries. Funny didn't realize the USA wasn't an ally of Nepal? Anyways don't bring in anything but water, monkeys will try to steal stuff from your hands and they will also try and attack you. Be careful, get your rabie shots!

aka Monkey Temple!. The view from the top of this temple was magnificent. While you can do the trek up the front steps, there is also a way to access from the back which is less steep and daunting.Although, the journey up the steps is meant to be both physical and mentally reflective. Be rewarded by the view of the city, and the giant Vajra that awaits you at the top.If you are lucky to have a good guide, as well as, a deep interest in understand what it all means, and the deep symbolisms, this is the place to start deciphering. Once you learn to read the patterns in the iconography, it is in a sense like the Da Vinci code, and seeing the meaning behind the Form.

Awesome monument zone in Kathmandu. Swayambhunath is a lovely and inspiring place spiritually with good views of kathmandu valley. You can see the Himalaya from the top.It's also called the monkey temple where u can see lots of money in your visit time. its a one amazing place in kathmandu. Please do not forget to visit this place. I love this place.

the EYES in the SKY. the variety of little,local stalls selling handicrafts and souvenirs were a pleasant break after a slight, steep(for an old man like me)climb.The ever present monkeys were rather a necessary evil.The pigeons were not that much of a trouble maker
Great view from top.. Excellent KTM view from top. Very spiritual. Be careful with monekys around. Steps are very steep so use rails.

Well worth the climb. The monkeys are a little freaky, but if you ignore them, they will ignore you. The temple itself is well worth a visit, and the views from the top are great. It is a steep climb, and you pass the usual number of vendors attempting (politely) to sell you their goods, but the area on top is beautiful, prayerful and I am very glad we hiked up to see it.

Swinging Monkeys. Up a long, steep flight of stairs, on the western edge of Kathmandu. At the top you are greeted by a large gold thunderbolt. A number of building surround the white dome of this Buddhist stupa. One you must go in is the Dongak Chyoling, an old monastery filled with candles. I was here at the end of the day to watch a hazy sunset over Kathmandu. The monkeys seem very active as the sun goes down. Highlight was watching the little ones swinging from strings of prayer flags like Tarzan.

Beautiful Buddhist Stupa on a hilltop. If you like buddhist stupas and you like climbing hills you'll like Swayambhunath. :) There are quite a few steps to climb in order to reach the top hilltop on which the stupa sits. This buddhist stupa is slightly smaller than the famous Bodnath Stupa but is very nice in it's own right. The fee to enter for foreigners is always steeper than for locals. I think it was around 250 Nepalese Rupees.There are several shrines around the stupa and lots of prayer wheels. The view of the kathmandu valley from the stupa is pretty great if it's a clear day. If you get lucky there are various gathering of monks in the morning doing their prayers.

An authentic temple experience. I loved this temple. Lots of interesting people there for different reasons. I visited with friends and spent a lot of time exploring the temple and the surroundings. Great shops and a great view. I was there during an important Buddhist festival. Great to see. A must if you're in Nepal.
Lots of monkey. Nice place but don't like the monkeys there. One almost took my camera from my hand. May be it is better in the evening time.
Lots of steps!. If you have trouble walking up steps - go to Bodnath Stupa instead! Good views despite the smog. Interesting to watch local people coming to the temple.

Breathless and beautiful. Walk from Thamel and experience another side of Kathmandu. The long flight of steps one at a time and the vista of Kathmandu is breathtaking. Turn all the prayer wheels! The temple is worth the visit!!!
Monkey temple. Not far from Thamel, just walk 30 minutes East and enjoy the view on Kathmandu (go early, it gets cloudy/dusty in the afternoon and you can't see anything

Interesting. The place offers a beautiful view and that is why I loved my trip to this place. This Buddhist temple is one of the oldest temple in Kathmandu and makes for a worthy visit. The place kind of have its own inhabitants in the form of monkeys that kind of rule the place but was actually fun to watch them. There is a climb to the temple so be prepared for those as well.

Monkey Temple < Boudananth. the monkey temple would have been more amazing if I hadn't already gone to Boudananth stupa which was breathtaking. Swayambhunath is similar in appearance, however on a smaller scale. the monkeys were fun though! and the giant stone staircase was a nice walk up. However, I wouldn't go again.

Well worth seeing. We visited Swayambhunath Temple to see the sun setting and it was a memorable sight. The temple itself is not too dissimilar from others, but it affords some splendid views across the sprawling conurbation of Kathmandu and the hills in the distance. We thought it was worthwhile. The vendors are a bit pushy, but you sort of expect that at places such as this. We weren't asked to pay an entry fee at any point, although we notice other visitors mention a 200 Rupee charge.

Monkey Temple. You have to climb the stairs to visit the temple, but it's totally worth it! It's a beautiful 2000 year old buddhist temple with great views from the Kathmandu valley!*There are lots of monkeys! =D
Great Visit!. The Entry fee is 200 Nepalese Rupees which in Sterling is approximately £1.50, but you get to see a range of Buddhist Temples and even some monks playing Carom!

Fun insight in to Buddhism. Great setting atop a hill overlooking the city and good to see the local people and pilgrim's at "prayer". The monkeys provide an element of fun.
Avoid if you do not like climbing steps.

Heart of the Kathmandu Story. While there were less monkeys than I had seen previously at this temple (which is not necessarily a bad thing), the story of the lotus flower with the blue light that beckoned visitors to Kathmanu Valleyis charming. You can almost believe that lotus flower really is still there, under the facade of the stupa. The hilltop vista provides incredible views of the valley, and the 7th century buddha statue hidden in a corner underscores that this area is still relatively unspoiled. Definitely worth a visit.

A quiet place to visit to avoid dusty Katmandu. From Thamel, you'll need 30 minutes walking. a nice place to visit.Go on the North, down and you'll reach the bouddha garden and all the local and small typical shops.

Great views even though hazy and foggy. I went late afternoon and enjoyed the temples and stupas. It is worth the walk up to get great views although even the sun was having problems getting through the haze of Kathmandu. Monkeys were entertaining but far too many dogs.I walked from Thamel in about half an hour but it is easy to get lost, so a short taxi ride is probably better.
Worth it. Go for the view if nothing else, it's amazing!! And the monkies are great to watch (especially in the monkey pool)

Fantastic. We made our way to Swayambhunath later on in the afternoon and there was only one coach tour there who were almost ready to leave. Despite the stalls beginning to close as we made our way round the temple sight it had a calm and peace about it. It was great watching the groups of monks chatting while the monkeys chased each other around. Well worth the visit across town and, in my view equally as impressive as Bouda.

A memorable experience. It is well worth the hike up several hundred steps to see the temples and stupas, along with the view of the valley down below and of course, the many entertaining monkeys; although the view was somewhat obscured by a moderate layer of haze.
Worth it in Kathmandu. This place (after the long stairs) will give you a very nice view of Kathmandu. The temples around are also very beautiful. Be aware of monkeys!
Inspirational Temple. An inspirational venue that needs to be experienced. Go with an open and enquiring mind and soak up the atmosphere.

Monkeying Around. One of my favourite places in Kathmandu is the Swayambhunath Temple. Part of a UNESCO World Heritage Site, Swayambhunath is a Tibetan Buddhist site of worship atop a substantial hill in the Kathmandu Valley, and is well known for its resident holy monkeys. After all, it’s not called the Monkey Temple for nothing!I had a nervy taxi ride from my hotel in Thamel all the way to Swayambhunath. I approached one taxi and asked how much for a return trip to the temple and I was quoted at 1200 rupees. This was too much for me, and I tried to haggle but the driver did not want to lower his price. So I walked up the road a little way and asked another driver, and he quoted me 750rupees, which was much closer to my original asking price of 500. I think my price was a bit hopeful, but in the end I was happy with what I got offered. 20 minutes later I had arrived at Swayambhunath Temple. My driver had taken me to the top of the temple, rather than drop me at the bottom so I could walk up the famous steps to the top. I don’t know why he did this, as for most people climbing the stairs is one of the most important parts of the visit. Oh well, at least I saved my energy! The taxi driver waited for me in the car park ready for when I needed the lift back to Thamel.The admission cost for an adult ticket for a ‘foreigner’ at Swayambhunath is 300 rupees. The first thing I noticed after paying for my tickets was a nice little pond with a golden Buddha in the middle. There were little buckets beneath this statue into which locals were trying to throw coins, presumably for good luck and well-wishing. I saw some rather large monkeys around this area, some of which were stalking around the pond, and others were hiding in trees grooming each other. After a short while, I headed eastward up the steps to the main part of the temple where the stupa and monasteries are situated. I noticed many lines of prayer flags as I was walking up these steps, and it really adds to the atmosphere of being in the Himalayas, as well as reminding me of my escapades in Bhutan at the Taktsang Monastery in addition to the Boudhanath Stupa here in Kathmandu.There were many stray dogs at the top of these steps, but fortunately they were all sleeping around a giant red Buddha statue. I didn’t want to disturb them so I went on my way quickly. Up here at the pinnacle of the hill, in addition to the stupa and the monasteries, I saw so many little shops and the odd café or two. I didn’t buy anything, but it was nice to peruse a little as I circled the stupa, and contrary to my expectations, the Nepali merchants were not pushy at all in trying to obtain my rupees!The main stupa of the Swayambhunath Temple is actually a mini version of the Boudhanath Stupa. However, here at Swayambhunath, there are other little decorative statues and monuments that encircle the stupa, including a giant Vajra. You will notice many of these pesky monkeys at this elevation at Swayambhunath, and although they didn’t bother me personally, it is claimed that they can attack you if you they are hungry and see that you have food in your bags, so it is always wise to be wary.After a good 45 minutes or so up at the Swayambhunath Temple stupa walking around getting some cool photos, and enjoying great views of the very polluted Kathmandu Valley down below, I decided it was time to head back down to the car park where my taxi driver was waiting for me. I allowed myself one last little look at the some of the monkeys congregating around the entrance near the wishing pond. I then had a little look at some of the items on sale in a market within the temple compounds, and was startled to find real Ghurkha swords on sale, which I didn’t think was very safe in an area which can be full of children. Still, I had a good time at Swayambhunath Temple, and I left with good memories of visiting yet another Tibetan Buddhist site.

swayabhunath.. We stayed near this stupa.I walked up around 350 steps to reach this.Last 100 steps are very steep & it makes you huff 7 puff but the view is excellent. There are quite a few monkeys here but they don't trouble you. While coming you should come back before the sunset as the steps are not lit & then it becomes very difficult to see the steps.

Must-go for cultural visit in Kathmandu. You cannot come to Kathmandu without visiting Swayambhu! It's one of the best place to see Nepal religious architecture. There are so many details that reflects the beliefs of people here. Also, you can observe religious practices around the place as well. You can take a taxi there if you want to save energy of walking up too many stairs!
So colourful. This was a fantastic place, although I did feel a little intrusive as, despite the number of tourists, it is primarily a place of worship

Monkey temple. Just take a walk up there and see what happens. I went twice, the first was on a Saturday so all the locals were there for a festival, the second time a couple of guys were on the top of stupa painting it in preparation for, you guessed it, a festival.

Lots of steps Great view. Nice place to wander to in the early morning or late afternoon You can watch the sunset or look over the city. You can climb up the steps at the front or take the slightly less strenuous path up the back but be careful of the monkeys if you are eating fruit there are a lot of them.

Peaceful and best View. There are many places to visit in Katmandu but Swayambunath really enchanted me.You can climb the steps to the top of the hill joking with monkeys but much easier access from the taxi stand on the other side...anyway a fantastic peaceful place. Also a nice view on the Katmandu Valley and some good breath of fresh air, far from the pollutions and confusion You find in Thamel. Don't forget to launch some coins in the "peace pool" near the main gate...

Wonderful place, nice view of Kathmandu city from top. We visited this place at Around afternoon. This is little outside of the city and the best part is it is on hilltop. We had a car which took us to the gate of the temple. Then we took the tickets (ticket price is nominal) and then started riding the stairs. When we reached the top we were mesmerized by the awesome view of Kathmandu city from top. The temple was clean and calm. We stayed there at least an hour, enjoyed the view, had a cup of coffee before leaving.
Nice place. Very nice old structure. Very peaceful once you are inside the temple. Maintained quite well. The peace on the faces of the monks was contagious.

A Must for Anyone Visiting Kathmandu. My first bit of advice: take the steps--all of them--to the top of the temple. Don't let anyone talk you into going around to the back--the easier way. This is the most effective way to watch the bustling, chaotic city of Kathmandu reveal itself layer by layer. If you are not in shape, take your time. There is a lot to see as you go up--monkeys, vendors, views, people, etc. Be sure to take some water along. Once you get to the top you are rewarded with spectacular views of the city and a rather spiritual experience as you explore the temple. Enjoy!

Nice view. Nice stupa with some monkeys walking around (didn't see many when I was there). The view from the top overlooking the valley is nice. The small buddhist temple beside the stupa is quiet impressive.

Better than Bodanath if you must choose one. Great 360' views of the city.
Awesome atmosphere with the temples and people and monkeys and worship music...
Some great shops for souvenirs.
The steps up and down the temples were another experience!
Sunset time is the best time to visit.

Very amazing. Swoyambhunath stupa lies near to Thamel and I went there in the morning before the sunrise and I had to climb about 350 steps all the way to the top of the hill of swoyambhunath. From the top you can have a very good view of the Kathmandu valley and the sunrise as well. It lies to the west of Kathmandu and is about 70 metres above ground level of Kathmandu. The environment around the hill is splendid and we can also call it as Monkey Temple as it is a home to many monkeys. Anyways it was very marvellous and it is a holy place for the Buddhists people but anyone can visit there.

Just wow. I used to go there almost every week during my stay in Kathmandu, it's really nice place to relax and to get rid off all the depression and stresses. It's really nice and peaceful place with a relaxing music and a great view of Kathmandu City
Sunset over the Kathmandu Valley. LOVED the monkeys. We took a cab from Bhaktapur to catch the sunset. Was brilliant! The monkeys are everywhere and super cute! Enjoy!

Such an interesting place. We came up the back way past the peace pond and avoided the three hundred odd steps. We looked in at the monks who where chanting and sounding the very long horns and playing drums. There was a table with about five hundred butter lamps burning. We looked at the amazing views over Kathmandu and wandered around the other temples and shrines that surround the Stupa. We had a quick look at the tourist shops at the back and watched the monkeys playing around the prayer wheels. A great place to visit

Depressing. After visiting Boudnath Stupa and it's marvelous surrounding area, this was depressing. I thought there was a general air of decay about it: it was messy, tatty, grubby and unkempt. (Unlike Boudnath where everything was immaculate.)There was noise, hubbub, aggressive dogs, aggressive monkeys and expensive coffee and no view (due to the excessive smog). And lots of steps. I didn't think it was really worth the fee or the time.

Worth the climb. It's worth the hot walk, even just to get out of the polluted city and to rise above the dustNice views over the city from the topThe monkeys didn't seem to aggressive however i saw one grabbing/stealing a snack from a local coupleInteresting temple, good photo opportunities

Extremely interesting and beautiful temple.. I really enjoyed visiting this temple as there is so much to see. First I walked round the outside, passing the hundreds of prayer wheels and people lighting candles, after which I ventured into the main entrance and up the many steps to the temple itself. Near the top of the steps is the ticket office, where the entrance charge is Rs200 for foreigners, which I thought was very reasonable. The temple has many interesting features and is a photographer's delight; additionally, with it being so high up, there are also amazing views over Kathmandu.The souvenir vendors can be a little irritating, but are not aggressive in their sales, and the choice of souvenirs available here is huge - anyone can pick up a bargain!I enjoyed the views, the history, the ambiance, and even the exercise climbing to the top!

Have to. Go early or at sunset time! It's an incredible place to seat for a while inspire all the people and monkeys around. The energy here is different, the light heat the stupas and statues and the dome of the Big One with such a bright!!!!! It's more intimate then the Boudanath, the other Stupa in Kathmandu. Make 3 clockwise round in silence with yourself. Allowed you to feel what makes this country so particular in lots of aspects.Enjoy the majestic 360 view of Kathmandu.

Good place to see!!!. I liked very much this place, monkeys everywhere. Placed in a hill, outside the city, you will have a terrific view of Kathmandu, One of the best temples to see. Good place to get some souvenirs, probably you will pay a 20% plus, but I didn't see all the same stuff I saw here.

Interesting trip to Swayambhunath, also called 'Monkey Temple". This is one of the holy sites for Buddhism and a bustling market place. One of the entrances includes a steep climb of over 350 steps to arrive to the top of the hill where Swayambhunath Temple is located. You get a good view of Kathmandu, although it seems like the city was covered with haze when we visited. Lots of merchants selling religious offerings and other souvenirs...and the merchants were friendly and low key, no pressure on tourists. It might be useful to have a local, certified guide to explain the significance of the temple. I met a Tibetan monk that was living there at the monastery and had a nice talk with him. Attached photos show some pictures of the temple and some of the monkeys that roam the grounds there. Be careful as the monkeys could become aggressive if you have food in your hands.
Don't miss it!. Unforgettable beauty and a photographers dream. Don't visit Kathmandu without visiting this location
city view. a palce where at least you can had a view of the kathmandu city. if travel by taxi. for older people would recommend to ride to the top. so can skip the stairs to the top.

Spectacular place!. This place had a bit of everything: great views of Kathmandu, cremations along the river, cool-looking sadhus (holy men), fascinating temples, and entertaining monkeys all over. Not to be missed!

Magnificent & peaceful. We visited Nepal last year of August this was the place i would never forget climbing the stairs was real fun coz we had no idea what is above us when we climbed up it was a magnificent view of Kathmandu valley and the slow religious music playing on the small shops near by was just perfect,we didn't know how we spent 3 hrs there just looking to the beautiful landscape  you should be careful with the monkeys all over there
Spectacular place to visit. This is an unforgettable sight. Photos do not do it justice. You have to be there to soak up the atmosphere and appreciate the importance of this place to the locals
Nice place. From this place you get a view of Kathmandu. There are too many monkeys at this place and some times bit scary too. It is interesting to see how monkeys dive in the small pool there!!

Great View!. We walked from Thamel to the Swayambhunath Temple. It’s a good walk and your typical walking like in Kathmandu (no sidewalks and traffic). Once you arrive at the temple you climb the stairs that aren’t too bad but there is quite a bit. Before you enter there is a fee. Once you are at the top you get great views of Kathmandu city and the temple is very pretty. We had a book on Nepal so it was helpful to read a little bit more about the temple to help us understand the history. The backside you can walk downstairs to another area which was fun to see. There were monkeys everywhere and even a monkey bath or watering area down below it was fun to watch them jump in the water. We walked back up to the temple from another side of stairs and explored some more. The Swayambhunath Temple is a must see if you are in Kathmandu and it makes for a good day trip.
Ordinary. This place has a nice view of Kathmandu city, but I don't recommend to visit this place if you don't have much time. Better places to visit in Kathmandu like Bhakatapur and Patan Kingdoms.

good for a short trek out of Thamel. It is a nice stroll up to visit. For about 200 rupees for the cab fare from thamel should be enough to get you there. Most cab drivers you will need to bargain and in the end you will end up paying more than locals anyway!

Interesting, educational, and quite impressive.. Recommend hiring a local for a tour guide for @ $10 US so you may be explained the rituals and importance of the temple. Impressive temples throughout and buildings, temples, and terrain are very a thing of artistry.
Amazing. Amazing temple ..u can see the city from top of the hill ..it's Worth the 365 step to reach the temple ..the view is great ..

Incredible experience. One can feel the energy in this place. There are nice guides that wait for you at the temple bottom and go all the way up with you explaining the different meanings of each área of the temple. Definitly worth it.

Amazing views of the city. If you want to see what Kathmandu city looks like from birds eye view you need to go to Swayambhunath stupa. The best way to get here is to take a cab or just book a car for a day and drive around town its much easier than haggling with taxi drivers.The stupa is set upon a hill so you can either drive half way up or if you are adventurous you can climb the steep stairs.When you are here do try and buy bodhchit bead prayer rosary. They are typical and quite valuable and difficult to come by everywhere.Be careful of the monkeys there are many. Normally they do not attack but, sometimes if they belief u are carrying food they may so please put away your plastic bags, backpacks and other bags are ok.There is a small museum area.
Stunning. A beautiful temple set on top of a hill so the views of Kathmandu are great. The only downside is all the steps. There is a lot of steps to get there

Great View, Very Peaceful, Could be cleaner. This is another Stupa in Kathmandu that is very peaceful and has a great view. Not allowed to go on the stupa itself like in Boudha tough. The place could be cleaner.

Top of the world, beautiful views of Kathmandu below. This is a must see while in Nepal, 2 ways of getting up the high monuments, either climb the 350 plus steps in front or go to the opposite side to climb maybe less than 100, much easier as far as I'm concerned.You reach the top and marvel in the several temples also called ther "monkey temple", with hundreds of monkeys all over the route; don't get too close though!Temples are beautiful and amazing!

nice hilltop temple complex. it is nicely set at the top of a hill with great views of the crazy city below. what makes this place the most fun is ho many monkeys there are just everywhere playfully running around. It is a nicely set up complex of temples and shrines that surround the large Stupa that is well maintained. sure there are gift shops within the vendors don't come out and bother you.

Nice view, but.... . From the top, you can see the panorama of Kathmandu city. Nothing special, but at least you can see the city from the top.But unfortunately, the place is not well managed, so many garbages and dusty. I remembered, when I bought a bottle of water to drink, I have to clean the dust on the bottle!!! OMG.
Cool place. Went to see the view of Kathmandu, it was nice... temples were amazing, loved the cool wind and environment.
Amazing Views. This is a must see so many temples so much history.. So many vies if you don't want to walk up all the steps take a taxi to the top not so many steps then to walk up.

Magical!. Visiting this Stupa may have been my favorite experience of our trip. Get your taxi to take you to the back entrance. Go right at dawn! At this time all the locals are out sipping tea and circling the Stupa before heading to work, and there were very few other tourists around. I got some fabulous pictures of monkeys on statues. They are everywhere, but keep valuables close and don't eat in from of them, and they won't bother you. The architecture was beautiful, and I'll never forget the heady mix of incense, the mumble of prayers, marigolds hanging from every statue and archway, and the sun coming up.

A wonderful viewpoint. It was a nice walk up the many steps to the temple at the top of the hill. Along the way you see merchants, monkeys and best of all, huge birds of prey that are swooping all around in the sky and resting in the trees beside the temple. It is almost like a free trip to an animal sanctuary thrown in. The temple itself is very nice and atmospheric, but the main reason to get up to the top is the views that it affords. Perhaps even go for a drink in one of the rooftop cafés they have to get that little bit higher and really soak it all in. Depending on when you go I'm sure that sunrise or sunset would both be equally stunning visually.

Monkey Temple of Kathmandu. We arrived at the temple late in the day. We drove up to the back entrance of the temple, there by avoiding the steep stairs at the front. This temple is gold upon gold upon gold. With beautiful prayer stones and off course another little stupa with prayer wheels.As we arrived there were black kites soaring just off the hill face and this provided just as much beauty as the temple itself. There are great views of Kathmandu from here. Off course the monkeys are delightful. Do hold onto your belongings, as they will come and investigate and abscond with anything you don't pay attention to. On the way out the front there are the steep steps that you will hear mentioned over and over again. There are monkeys everywhere of all sizes, try to take a snack with you and sit and watch the people or the kites or the monkeys.Just hold on to everything.

365 steps. It's one of my favourite ancient religious complex. And to climb all the way up is definitely worth it.However, we found out that there is another entrance in the back which your taxi can drive up.There is a huge white stupa to greet you after the climb.You also find a few smaller religious complexes & some stupas on top of the hill.The view is amazing, you get to see the Kathmandu valley.If you like, buy some bananas from the market before visiting this temple as you may want to feed the hungry monkeys there. You may want to take a photo with the Sadhu( religious man with dreadlocks and wearing a yellow robe) but, you gotta give him a tip. Then, be prepared for him to bless you and put some ash on your forehead.Be prepared to spend about 2 to 3 hours here.
Other world. To get to the place is quite an adventure, but is worth the view of the city and of course the whole site is gorgeous!

A must see if you visit Kathmandu. Swayambhunath Temple is an ancient religious temple atop a hill in the Kathmandu Valley. It is also known as the Monkey Temple as there are many monkeys that can be found around the stupa. The Swayambhunath Temple consists of stupa, varieties of shrines and temples, some of them are dating back to ancient period. You can see the entire Kathmandu from the Swayambhunath hill and the view is just breathtaking. There are also restaurants and shops atop the hill. Overall it was an awesome experience.

Great Experience..Always!. The long stair walk up to the temple area just sets the stage for the entire experience that awaits you once on top! It is spiritual, colorful and well worth the visit. I go every day I am in Kathmandu and if you keep your entrance ticket to show you do not need to keep paying the fee on each visit!
Beautiful Structure. Really is something to see. Couple that with the outstanding views of the Kathmandu area, it is worth the visit. Loved the monkeys too.

Buddhist shrine at the top of the Kathmandu. An ancient religious shrine on the top of a hill in the Kathmandu Valley, west of Kathmandu city. It is also known as the Monkey Temple as there are monkeys living in the north-west parts of the temple. The hill top, Swayambhunath complex consists of a stupa, a variety of shrines and temples, some dating back to the Licchavi period.The stupa has Buddha's eyes and eyebrows painted on. Between them, there is something painted which looks like the nose - but is the Nepali symbol of 'unity'. The site has two access points I have tried both in different times: a long stairway, claimed to have 365 steps, which took 10 minutes for me to scale, leading directly to the main platform of the temple, which is from the top of the hill to the east. The first sight on reaching the top of the stairway is the large Vajra (symbol represent firmness of spirit and spiritual power). Another entrance is a car road around the hill from the south leading to the southwest entrance. Much of Swayambhunath's iconography comes from the Vajrayana tradition of Newar Buddhism (local resident of Kathmandu valley). However, the complex is also an important site for Buddhists of many schools, and is also revered by Hindus.,From Swaymbhunath you can view Kathmandu valley and enjoy being on the top of Kathmandu valley.

Excellent temple with view of the Valley. A well maintained temple on the hill.You can see almost entire Kathmandu valley from the top.Ancient way of worshipping and rollers made of brass like material.Must visit if you are in kathmandu Shopping: there r shops enroute - all r bargain shops and start with 50%of what they quote n don't pay more than 60% of quoted price.Example: bought few articles for 200 Nepal rupees that were quoted 350.
Monkey Temple. A feast to the eye with so much to see and mother monkeys caring for their young. Don't even think of touching them!

Top sight in Kathmandu, don't miss!. We walked from Thamel thru choking moto exhaust and deafening noise…it is across incredibly plastic-choked river, BUT, 350 steps up is the uber-cool Hindu-Buddhist stupa with monkeys, rooftop cafes, and a sense of timeless devotion at the very very beautiful stupa.

Great views. We walked here from Durbar Square which took about 40 mins and was a great experience on it's own and gives a feeling of the relatively small scale of Kathmandu. You can see it from rooftop restaurants then just follow your nose, cross river and you will not miss glimpses of temple hill. Sight itself was great with views back across the city and of the whole Kathmandu valley. Monkeys are fun to watch especially when raiding unsuspecting tourists also cool dog gangs on steps up to temple. We walked around base of hill and then grabbed a mini taxi ride back to central Kathmandu - the route through the narrow Thamel streets was an excursion on it's own. A great afternoon.

Very very nice. Everything here is faschinating. I went along with the manager of the homestay I stayed in, he showed me around and told me all the historic fact about it...It was awesome feeling to be able to know about the place I was visiting..
The Amazing View. It has an amazing view upstairs. The entire KTM city in the valley can be observed from the heights.
